What you'll get instead is top notch ignorance from their stuff to your e-mails, absolute disinterest to your problems (which they caused), employees that don't read what you write (if they decide that they're actually going to respond to you), absolutely generic response, which I have to applaud them for because I've never seen such a diplomatic way of telling you 'Go f... yourself', or response that basically has energy of 'I'm so sorry I lost you earrings, but I'm sure you'll find them one day, just be patient and wait.' What they do is clearly 'circle tactic, because every time you write a message (through instagram) somebody else will answer to you, so you'll write 9 messages and you'll get 9 responses (if you're lucky) from 9 different people who did not read you previous messages, which results in you going in circles.

Great value, I wore my On the Fly pants into the ground. Love my Dash into Dusk zip running jacket and cropped long sleeve top too. Shipping is fast and customer service is good - ignore all the negative reviews below that are during the pandemic, obviously things are different at the moment and delays are inevitable.
They cancelled my order for no reason, haven’t refunded and i have no way of getting in contact with them since their live chat is off. disappointed.

Worse costumer representative help . They go in circles and not really willing to help you on anything . Paid 800 for my order . This will be the last one . I am disappointed forever . This brand has never really cared for its costumers. Ive been a sweatcollective member for many years . I cant return anything nor i was put on hold for two hours for them to tell me that i cant do anything

I have tried to make a return for weeks.  No response with customer service.  when I did get someone they sent me a return label that was a blank.  I am so frustrated and concerned i will have to keep something that doesn't fit and is past the return time.I have called, tried the online help and have waited hours and still no support

I returned 3 items, tracking tells me they have had them 20 days and I still have no refund? No way to contact them, I have tried for over a week. No one answers phone, they tell you to chat or text and there are messages “ sorry not available “ . I will have to call my credit union to dispute the charges . This is no way to do business, I will never order or go to their stores.

Awful online customer support and extremely slow delivery.I assumed the delivery is taking for ever because of Covid but after 2 friends ordered the same item a week after me and received it within a few days Iam pretty sure Covid has nothing to do with it. The worst is the lack of customer support I reached out via email and twitter and in both cases got referred to someone else?!!!! Given their price tags I’d expect better customer service.

I am reading reviews on this site and I am completely perplexed, someone used the word "trousers" .. Lululemon sells Yoga pants and active wear. Lululemon is a Canadian company based out of British Columbia Canada. They have retail locations and online shopping. During Covid the retail stores have been closed, the educators have been working from home and the company is still fulfilling online orders ( I know I placed one in April) Lululemon has a great ethos as a company and will take back any item that doesn't meet your standards or that falls short of performance (sometimes manufacturing defects happen) Lululemon has always also had a policy where you can take items ordered online into a retail location for exchange or refund or you can send it back to them and they send you prepaid labels. Currently stores are closed, Canada post is backlogged! if you order online and you need to return they need to receive the product before they issue you a refund.. it has ALWAYS been like this. This company is expensive but they stand by their customers and their products.  I have been a customer since 2014 and have an online account with them that will verify this. Absolutely recommended :)

About a month ago I received tracking verification that my returned items had been received by Lululemon, but still haven't received credit to my visa. Can't get through to customer service via phone, so emailed and got a response days later saying due to covid19 everything takes longer. However, Lululemon has no trouble instantly charging your card upon order placement and most reputable companies issue credit once a returned item is back in their possession. Maybe Lululemon is using customer funds to finance cash flow during this shutdown? I will never purchase from them again.

Ordered a racer back size 4 for my daughter on April 6. Received it after her birthday which was April 10 and that was ok, however, she didn’t decide to wear it until recently.  Cut the tags and put it on to discover it was more than one inch longer and wider than her other size 4s, of which she has numerous.  Although she took it off immediately and I notified the customer service department with a photo of the new compared to the old, they told me she stretched it out.  Funny thing...wouldn’t the old one be larger than the new one? Just proves they are not reviewing each customer complaint but rather saying “no” to what comes across their desk! Very, very poor customer service!

ordered a pair for my daughter, waited 4 weeks, no pants but the bill sure hit my credit card. Can't get a response from Lululemon despite many attempts over a few weeks. Had to put in a dispute on the charge with my credit card company.

Terrible customer service. Cancels orders but charges your account.  Items they cancel are still in stock?? Impossible to get in contact with.  Trust me it's a nightmare.  I will never purchase from them again, buyer beware
Ordered 2 pairs of trousers. Shipping took a while and one of the trousers came with the security tag attached.

So far... so GREAT!I only discovered the site a month ago and only placed one order so far.It's been a GREAT experience!Great quality.Very professional and friendly l Customer Service.All in all a very good experience!I shall be back .

i’ve been shopping at lulu for 4 years now and i have no complaints. i will say that i did return 3 items and one of the items took a month to get to the return center but that isn’t lululemon’s fault. i’ve read a lot of these one star reviews and it’s all about customer service. i just would like you guys to consider that they aren’t going to have enough people working their live chat at the moment because EVERYONE is trying to return something, or has a question. there’s only so many people that want to talk to complaining customers all day long on a computer. there is also a huge back up due to the pandemic and you can’t blame lulu for that. they are doing their best to keep all of their workers safe so there is a obvious decrease in staff right now so that’s why everything is taking so long. i would also like to bring up the fact that no one NEEDS to return or buy things NOW. all we are doing is staying home so it doesn’t matter if you have that bra you’ve been wanting now or in two weeks. people are just so impatient and insensitive and it’s sad to see.

They were very prompt. The website said my order would ship by a certain date even before I completed the order and sure enough it did, even during Covid 19. Very impressed and the wife loves the sweaters she got in time for Mother’s Day! I now have the app on my phone, I will be ordering from them more often!

We are very disappointed with this purchase. My 13-year-old has been saving up for months to get her one and only pair of lululemon leggings. She was trying to save money by getting a pair in the"sale" section. We looked at the model that represented which said she was 5' 10" and wore a size 6 and thought, a 2 would be perfect since that is exactly what she wears for EVERYTHING else. She tracked the package and couldn't wait for them to arrive. She received the package and even did an"opening video" and couldn't wait to try them on. She put them on and couldn't even get them above her knees. She said they were so tight and small that they wouldn't even work. So, my 10-year-old tried them on, who wears a size 7-8 GIRLS and they fit perfectly. My oldest daughter was so upset. So, we tried to go online and fix the problem. We couldn't return them, we couldn't exchange them, and we couldn't get a hold of anyone on live chat, email, or call! This was the most frustrating thing to go through. And, we are out $80that my daughter worked so hard to save up and order these with. And, she is upset that now her sister gets to wear them and she doesn't get the leggings SHE ordered! I am trying to teach my children the value of money, but I feel this was a complete WASTE and I would have a very hard time letting them order again. Also, don't tell a 13-year-old girl, who usually wears a size 2, that she should wear an 8??? That is a horrible self-esteem thing you might not want them to have issues with later on in life. The quality of the pants was great! The 10-year-old loves them. I just wish it would have worked out better for my daughter who actually ordered them. AND! Now I tried to submit a review through the email that THEY sent to me, and it won't go through. Ugh!
Horrific customer service and quality has gone south .I want the old lulu!!!Now just high priced crap.

I purchased the Awake to Lace Bra*A?E Cups and when I received it I tried it on and it was too small. I ordered size 38D, which is comparable to what I usually get from Lululemon. I believe either is was mislabeled or it was not described correctly on their site. What's also frustrating is that I tried to contact them and was put in a queue for Live Chat for over 40 minutes and then then queue would restart. Ugh!
Ordered an item and they cancelled the order.  I followed up and they claimed it was out of stock. Yet the item was still listed for sale on their website.

Hey Lulu trash You never surprise me, your unparalleled trashy business is a landmark of low class job, the order has not been delivered , it showed on FedEx tracking that it was delivered but it wasn’t , it was a Mother’s Day gift and you ruined it , I’ll make you an example on social media , you stupid lousy trash.

Normally I’d say I love lululemon and always have decent service, but not anymore. I recently returned a pair of pants online and was expecting to receive a direct refund back into my bank account. It has now been over a month since I sent them back and they just now emailed me saying they received them. After receiving this email, I discovered they refunded me an egiftcard. I did NOT want a gift card nor was I informed I was getting one until it showed up in my mail. I tried emailing their costumer service who has not been even close to helpful. They emailed me back in a pretty rude manner claiming I did not tell them I wanted a refund Back into my bank account. They also said now that the egiftcard has been sent out they can’t refund me. So now here I am stuck with a one hundred dollar egiftcard to lululemon which I will never use. Overall this experience has been nothing but horrible, stressful, and very disappointing. I do not plan on ever purchasing anything from this brand again, they are not worth it.

I'm surprised at the bad reviews for Lululemon.com. I live abroad so every time before I go see my family in NY, I order Lululemon from the website before I arrive so I could try them on at home and return in the shops if something doesn't fit. I'd never had any issues receiving or returning orders. Products are pricy but most items are very well made with quality fabric and stitching. The sports bra I bought 6 years ago still retained good shape after numerous wearing and washing.

Terrible service online. They over charged my credit card, I have no receipt, I can't log in, when I phone it says they're closed and when I email it says they'll reply in 3 days, not including weekends. I've never had such a bad experience before and I'm really surprised to have this from this company.

I have had nothing but trouble with trying to get a credit card reimbursement for returning 2 items. I purchased a pair of shorts and a t-shirt for my husband's birthday in early March. Unfortunately he needed different sizes so he went to the store with the two items and the gift receipts to exchange or refund. He decided he did not want the items and wanted to return. The sales staff were rude to him and refused to give him credit refund because he did not have the store receipt (only gift receipts). He said he (or I) would return with the receipt. THEN the virus shut everything down so I began the return process through online access. Eventually (March 22) after sending pdfs of the items and the receipt LuLu lemon agreed to refund my credit card and sent me the necessary paperwork to pack and return the items which I immediately did. Today (May 4th) I am still waiting for my credit refund - I have called and written many times and I keep getting very "nice" responses saying that they are working on my refund and it will be 1-2 days, 5-7 days, 10-15 days, etc.  I am now in serious doubt of ever receiving my credit refund and this experience has convinced me to NEVER buy from them again.

I have been shopping at Lululemon for years.  I have never had to return an item so far. Then I ordered two mats - the 5mm reversible mat tore right away with just normal use in about two weeks.  I have been trying to return it ever since I contacted them.  They make me fill out this form and take pictures.  Fine, I did that.  Then they say they will get back to me in 7 - 10 days.  Okay.  Then they send me another email saying fill out another form and take pictures.  I am so frustrated.  Can’t believe this.

Have only ever had poor experiences with the online store. I‘ve ordered the align II 25” pant  online twice now, both times received an email saying my order has been cancelled, with no explanation as to why. Waited around 3 hours for live chat customer service, was told that the item was out of stock when I ordered it. Googled this issue and seems to happen very often. Have supported this brand for around 8 years, only ever had issues with the online store. Products are high quality and service is great in store locations, do not recommend buying online though. Overall a 3/5 star rating is fair for my experiences with them.

I first started buying Lululemon about a year ago. At first it was fine, I felt like I got prompt responses when I need to do returns or exchanges. Over the last six months their customer service has absolutely tanked.I realize that there is a pandemic going on but this seems unrelated. For example, the last 4 items I’ve tried to return I never got a shipping label. When I finally got an email (after reaching out to customer service) it was blank/wouldn’t download. They then stated that they would send me another and the return authorization slip. I got the labels, no slip. Then needed to contact them again. Then I requested an email gift card instead of a mail gift card. Was told they cannot do that (even though 6 months ago that was the procedure). Still haven’t gotten the gift card for one return that was initiated almost 2 months ago and have been trying to mail back another item for a month. This is ABSOLUTELY INSANE. First of all “final sale only” on their we made too much items isn’t realistic when the physical stores are closed. Second, this stuff is still expensive and I expect good service. I’ve never had issues like this with UnderArmour or Nike or ASICS. Just Lululemon. In addition, I wrote a review on one of their leggings and I explained that while their items are “guaranteed”, they are so hard to deal with when you need to return something that it isn’t worth it to depend on their guarantee.... THEY EMAILED ME THAT THEY WOULD NOT POST MY REVIEW BECAUSE IT INCLUDED INFORMATION NOT PERTAINING TO THE ITEM ITSELF!I WILL NOT buy Lululemon again. I will also share my experiences with anyone I can because they shouldn’t be in business.

I initially ordered a yoga mat and paid for it to be told a week later that it’s actually out of stock. I then ordered a yoga mat on the 6th of April. I have yet to receive it. I have emailed, called and now been in the waiting room for the live chat for 5 hours. I have not received responses to my emails and the calls are not answered. The WORST customer service. If you want to provide an online platform to shop then you must sort your customer service out. It’s shocking. If you can’t provide the full online shopping experience which includes customer service during Covid-19 then stop taking orders.

Do NOT Buy ONLINE. I beg you.I spent 118 pounds on leggings on the 7th of April and it is now the 29th of April and the item has not arrived neither do I have a refund. They promised to send me a tracking number and have not. This is the worst customer service I have ever experienced and I now have to spend hours out of my work day for the past month chasing for a refund. I think the truth be told their customer services is not on shore meaning that it is probably in another country where the time difference causes huge delays. They do not seem to care that there competitors such as Sweaty Beatty, Gym Shark and Under Armour are SOOOO much better and care about resolving issues( and the products are much nicer). I still cannot believe they stole 118 pounds from me and i do not have my products. I am at wits ends what to do. They are also extremely expensive for what you get.  Do NOT buy online: It is Slow and they do not issue refunds even if the mistake is on there end. Read all of the reviews and you'll see the UK branch is terrible. If it were me try I would try Sweaty Beatty, Gym Shark and Under Armour. Gym Shark do the loveliest leggings and i wish I had just gone there but someone bought me a 50 pounds lululemon voucher so I was forced to use it. DO NOT BUY VOUCHERS THERE EITHER. BUYER BEWARE.

I amLulu customer from last 6 years and I have tons of clothes from this brand. Pretty much every pants , joggers and T-shirt’s and shorts .It used to be my favourite brand but NOT ANYMORE.I must say company has gone really trash in terms of products quality and raised prices way too much for nonsense, Also, I would recommend , DO NOT SHOP ONLINE ( we made too much session specially which is final sale of lulu) . Sizes are way too off! Try going in store only.

I bought three pairs of high rise tights for an incredibly expensive price. But due to COVID-19, the customs tax in my country increased dramatically so when my package came, it was charged a heavy sum. I returned it, then received information about my returns. THEY MISSED OUT 1 QTY! Not only that, I emailed GEC about the error, they did not respond until I emailed them again 5 days later. They said they will refund the additional 1 unit as well, but today, I received a refund confirmation. Not only did they miss out TWO UNITS, they set the refund amount as 0?!? What a trash company and I should've read trustpilot before placing the order.

I am so disappointed with my lululemon leggings. I bought the align super high rise. I washed them in cold water and inside out. Hung them to dry but they pilled on both legs. If I could upload a picture of them I would. It will be the last pair of leggings that I buy. It is not worth the money.

Been trying to return my items for over 2 weeks with no answers to my calls, emails or live chats. Website is still trading and accepting new orders and Instagram still posting new content. Terrible service after I have been such a loyal customer to their brand for such a long time. Phones are disconnected and head office is shut. I have no way to find out where to send my return or whether it would even be accepted and refunded.

Horrible service. I want to return a yoga mat but never received a return label. Customer service is not reacting to any of my mails. Packaging and quality of the mat were poor as well, lululemon- never again!

Ordered two yoga mats, only ever received one, although to be fair the delivery courier stuffed it up. i Have not been able to reach a human being at Lululemon after a month of trying. I do not need an "EDUCATOR." My package is missing, I need SERVICE.

Two pairs of Pace Breaker shorts fell apart (stitching has gone and there are holes in the material) within less than 6 months of purchasing the items - and that’s without any rigorous use. I have found other brands such as Under Armour far better for practical use and for longevity. To add, the customer service is the worst that it has ever been. As a customer since 2013, I found that they used to have excellent, proactive, and helpful customer service. Now you receive an email that contains limited support and/or solutions with an arrogant under tone. They are of no help dealing with poorly made garments.

I regret to admit that the customer service has turned to complete and utter garbage. I have reached out to "guest educators"on various different occasions and they are just not equipped to deal with my issues and ultimately do not resolve the problems at hand. In addition, they are extremely unprofessional and rude. It appears that lululemon is going down hill very fast, which is such a shame! Get your act together!

Awful customer service.  This is a complete crap show.  This will be the downfall of this company.  I tried to return a $200 jacket. It’s been a month with no refund!  Customer service wait on phone is over an hour.  No help!  Never again....

I have had problems with missing items, incorrect items, items with security tags attached and being sent someone else’s order entirely including their personal details. If the order is incorrect customer service doesn’t even apologise and you have to go to the trouble of shipping it back. If an item is missing, they won’t provide a refund. Lululemon needs to be a lot more careful at packing orders correctly. In addition there is a high chance the items will have bad sewing or flaws in the fabric and the returns process is far more difficult and time consuming than it should be. The IT systems are buggy and the customer service staff aren’t intelligent enough to understand the issues with them and blame them on you. The customer service staff are unbelievably rude and take days or weeks to respond. It is a risky proposition ordering from this company unless you don’t mind a lot of hassle and losing your money.

I just waiting over 4 hours for chat on a return that I made that was delivered but no credit and after that amount of time sitting waiting for chat, the icon appeared and said it was closed.  I have never been so disappointed in a company and the customer service. I will question buying from them again.

Im so fed up with their off sizing. I am normally a size 6 in Lululemon bottoms, I bought a pair of shorts online and they’re so tight and ride up constantly. I bought them online so obviously I couldn’t try them on beforehand but I suspected they’d be the correct size for me being that I am usually a size 6. Why can’t their sizing just be consistent. It’s so annoying to go back and forth because something doesn’t fit right. They charge so much money for there to be such a hassle. Never purchasing from here again. It’s not even worth the money. It’s just the brand name that sells. The quality is not even that good. Nike has better quality quite honestly.

I returned sport bras over a month, I still did not get the refund. I tried to contact customer service via live chat and phone call, but both are very long line. I waited over an over and the phone got cut.Very disappointed

Horrible experience with lululemon. I ordered a pair of leggings over month ago.  I’m at home during the suppose time my order was said to be delivered. NEVER GOT IT!  Get with their customer service they offer to send replacement pair or refund. I asked for them to send new pair of course I get charged again with no refund. Get email they will new order number. Then waited and waited then over two weeks later i get email my order was cancelled and no refund that i was charged twice for. Just horrible horrible!

Purchased a pair of leggings only to have them piling after 2 wears. Contacted customer service. Was told I would be emailed a form to fill out. Filled that out. Was told I needed to fill out a second form and send specific pictures. Waited 2 days to receive the link to that form. Filled it out. Waited another 3-4 days for a response. Said to send my item back and they would issue me a gift card for a new purchase. My label would not load and my RA said not found. Waited hours to talk to someone on live chat who said they would send a new label within 48 hours. Emailed as well. The email I received back said they couldn't reissue the label and to track my refund and print from the website, I had already specified in the email I was unable to track my refund because it said RA not found. So despite having to wait days for a reply they didn't even bother to read my message or answer correctly. The process to return a defective item has taken over 2 weeks just to get to the point where I could actually mail the leggings back. I still can not track my refund, despite having FINALLY been able to send it back. I will definitely NOT be purchasing from Lululemon again. The prices are high and the quality is NOT good enough to justify the price. HORRIBLE customer service. No one should have to wait days and days for a simple question to be answered only to have their question not even fully answered. Who knows how long it will take before I receive a gift card to purchase something else. Ridiculous.

I received the wrong pair of pants in the mail. It was addressed to me on the outside but it was the complete wrong order in my package. I had to wait 2 hours to even get ahold of anyone in customer service and when I did, the person I talked to was not helpful. They said they would send me my correct order in 7 business days. Absolutely ridiculous. They also could not send me a confirmation email right then, he said it would be 24-48 hours till my "new order" would even be placed. I don't trust that the correct product will be sent to me anytime soon.
Lululemon used to have a wonderful customer service but that's unfortunately no longer so. Very bad and unhelpful customer service. Huge disappointment!

If I could give then a minus one I would do that. I returned a pair of leggings about 3 weeks ago. No receipt from Fed Ex was given even though he had an order to pick the package up and you had supplied a label.  I have no idea of the status of my return or if they even know I exist because I cannot reach them. I have tried via phone numerous times. Wait times are never less than 3 hours. My sincere wish is for them to go out of business because they don't make anything that you can't get elsewhere from more reliable and honest merchants.

Really bad experience online. I was sent the wrong product and the right pants have not arrived - 6 weeks later. This has been an expensive waste of time so far, with lots of time on customer service calls and chat. watch out!

Unfortunately I did not read the return policy before I purchased sale items and now I can’t return these clothes and I’m stuck with very small and tight fitting clothes for my daughter and we did go by the size chart on the site. All I really wanted was an exchange but they wouldn’t help me out.

I own a fair bit of lululemon wear - I use it as a base layer for skiing as it moves with you. However I will no longer be purchasing any of their product. I have never been so frustrated with a company. They have a sweat collective to offer discounts to adults who coach or teach activities and as an active, full time ski instructor I do not qualify. Teaching skiing will never make me thousands of dollars so any discounts I can get on the products I need to stay warm I look for and encourage other people to try them as well.  Lululemon will no longer get my support -
I use these everyday at work and love the fit, really comfortable just a touch pricey

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I would rate negative stars if I could. I have been misled by so many different “educators” who think they know what they’re talking about but every new person I chat with seems to have a different response. They have delayed my return request for a month now and refuse to even look at it. Such a terrible company that overcharges their customers and treats them like trash when they reach out for help. So awful

I recently had to make an online order with Lululemon after they sent me a wrong size. It was a sale item and when I called to get the correct size they were out of stock. After reading the reviews on here was nervous about the return process. With that, I was pleasantly surprised by the customer service over the phone. Not only are they replacing the item with a non-sale item I chose (no extra cost), they are also refunding me for the original purchase because of the mix up. Very happy with the ease and assistance they offered!

Absolutely deplorable online experience and even worse customer service in the aftermath. They broke one order into seven separate shipments, each one incurred expense, not to mention the environmental impact, which clearly they couldnt not care about. Then they charged my credit card multiple times for hundreds of dollars more than the order itself. Calls to customer service were a complete waste of time as they had no sensible explanation for any of this, nor remedies for resolution. This is a clueless, descipable company that doesn't deserve my business and won't receive it again.
I had a terrible shopping experience at the Lulu Lemon store in Moorabbin (DFO). This experience will certainly stop me from going back to any Lulu Lemon store in the future.
The worst customer service ever. Totally dishonest cowboy outfit. AVOID

I bought a pair of Lululemon tights for my daughter 2 months ago and she already got a hole in the knee. She has way cheaper tights that have lasted a long time without getting holes. The quality is just not there sadly.

First; if i order a $100 pair of leggings I want them to be squat proof (Not see through when bending over) Returned!Second; My return arrived back to lululemon on 2-12-20 and I'm being told (per customer service) not to expect a refund before 3-17-20. Over a month for a return is excessive / ridiculous, especially for the price their merchandise runs. Third; I was also a little shocked that the packaging for their items was so poor ($100 leggings just stuffed loosely in a thin mailing package) I've ordered $30 leggings that, at least, came in a bag with the brands name protecting the items. Was not impressed with my first order and do not plan to order again.

Delivery was alright and came in 5 days. Packaging could be so much nicer for such a premium product brand and is a little too sleazy for my liking (no real effort out into it).However, the leggings themselves speak volumes. Money defo buys quality in this instance. The fit is great and is a must buy for working out.

I purchased over &600 dollars worth of clothing from Lululemon on 2-2-2-20.  On 2-5-20, my cc was charged.  The tracking stated that the item was "ready to go."  I spoke to their staff and was told that I had to wait until the package was past due on 2-13-20.  My package had not even left stating still "ready to go."  I called the staff again and was told that they would give me a refund and send the items that were still in stock.  I still have not received an email notification of this transaction.  I will NEVER purchase any more items from them.  In addition, I will give as much negative attention to the pop up location where I live on Hilton Head Island.

I’ve purchased thousands of dollars worth of items from Lululemon and have always been pleased.But it only takes one REALLY poor CS experience to lose a customer for life. A $20 missing package and I can’t get Fed-Ex or Lululemon to help. They keep asking me to wait “4 days” and once the 4 days pass... they make me wait another day. My trust in them taking care of me as a valued customer has vanished in this one incident.
Took ages for a refund... More than 2weeks and one item came with a fault. Wouldn't order again from lululemon.

I have had 2 bad experiences in their stores, I always had a good experience purchasing even though I never received any help whenever I come in, maybe because I look "young" but I had a few items that were ripping at the seams and pilling so bad and decided to take them in and explain to see what was happening. I only took in one item to see what would happen and the man was so nice and didn't even ask but decided to exchange it for a new one. I was surprised and decided to see if my other damaged items would be fixed as well and the workers told me no because they were too old and lectured me on their return policy. It just amazes me how they start off so nice and friendly but when you have a return they quickly look at each other and make comments. I called the other location and explained and they said to bring the items in and it will depend on the sales associate that sees it. I went and had the same experience. Just horrible, how some sale associate are so nice and some are completely rude and unhelpful. I decided to not deal with it and let my husband go in because he was white and sometimes I feel racially profiled as an Asian, and just his luck he was able to return them without a problem or a lecture. I have spent thousands of dollars on their products but all their seams always tear and to be treated like some con-artist trying to "return" old items/ gifts without receipts seem unfair.

Absolutley brutal! Constantly on hold and I rarely get people I can understand. The on hold music is terribly annoying and it doesnt even come thru clearly. It takes forever to get an issue resolved or even do a simple return. I cringe everytime I have to call.

I agree with the other opinions expressed here that Lululemon is appallingly slow at processing returns and cares very little about customer satisfaction.  They also operate under completely different sizing guidelines so that you cannot begin to guess what size you wear in Lulu-clothing. I purchased a sweatshirt and returned it because it was too small.  It has been sitting at their warehouse for two weeks without being refunded. I have contacted the company multiple times only to be told they need 7-12 days to process an item. Well, you’ve had 14! They claim it has only been 9 business days though and even though every time they are willing to admit they have received the item they claim there is “nothing” they can do to speed the return! This is absolutely a lie and unnecessary. It is an electronic transaction. It didn’t take them 12 days to charge my credit card for the item.  After badgering them to refund my card, they email me back and saying that actually the item got to the warehouse three days later than we originally told you (Twice) so now the refund will take longer.  Also, don’t bother writing an honest review of their actual clothing. If you give something one star they will say they were unable to publish the review.

I did  order on line  for a first time and I was very surprised when my pants and my husband sweatshirt arrive in ugly grey bag !Try to contact customer service for explanation and they told me they don’t carry shopping bags in the warehouse. They try to be environmentally friendly 😪. You paid same price like at the store and package arrived like garbage! Plus customer service is terrible. No more lululemon for me !

Bought daughter a pair of their fitness leggings at a cost of £88. She wore them once, fell over on an indoor netball court and one of the knees ripped. Was told in no uncertain terms in store that it was because "she fell over", no s**t sherlock. I explained that I would expect a much sturdier product for that price. I've bought leggings for much less than that and fallen over outside on gravel and they haven't ripped, but to no avail. 2 weeks worth of e mails back and forth asking for explanations and photos (repeating myself a few times) I then had confirmation that their online customer services will accept the return and issue me with a gift card. They initiated the return quite quickly, i received my return label and I delivered my parcel to the local UPS on 14th Feb, according to UPS tracking the package was delivered on 19th Feb. It is now the 13th March and i have received no refund, no gift voucher, they have not replied to my e mails or my messages via facebook and their live chat does not work.  If i could give them negative stars I would.

Bought 2 pair of leggings in a moment of weakness. Both snagged within 30 days of each other. I heard that they warrant their product and so I went to the store but was dismissively told that their 'warranty' only applies when the stitching comes apart. My daughter convinced me to give the company another chance so I went to their online 'chat' site. I was suspect when the intro line (before I even asked a question) was basically an admonishment about what's NOT covered by their product warranty. I was dumbfounded though when very next statement from the rep was basically to get lost. Under 15 seconds from 'hello' to 'screw you' is a new record in my world but probably not in Lululemon's world. At $150 per customer ($300 from fools like me who bought 2 pair at once), I guess they can afford to stay in business without repeat business.
Terrible service little prod avail delivery dates moved out and delivered to wrong address with no timely resolution or service!

Lulu lemon employees were pleasant but so beyond unhelpful. I had gotten a return approved and they emailed me saying I would get a gift card with my refund within 5-7 business days. 7 business days pass and I hadn’t received anything. I email again and tell them I hadn’t received anything and they said they messed up and that it should be 7-12 business days. I wait more and nothing happens I call costumer service and they were no help at all and this entire experience was awful. The employees were nice but overall did absolutely nothing to help and just pushed back the time over and over again. For a company with such high standards for quality their customer service is awful. Very disappointed.
Such an amazing experience! Lovely staff at Emporium Melbourne Store - really helpful but not pushy :) Very personalised and thoughtful! Got myself some awesome new tights and love them!

Their Customer Service is awful.  I was trying to get a refund on a gift card sent in the mail that never arrived and was told by 3 different people that as long as I issued a police report and the officer got in touch with them, a new card would be re-issued.  After doing all that they asked and numerous calls back and forth the story changed and they would not issue a new card.  All they had to do was tell me from the get go!!!  It was a total waste of my time and even worse, they would not give me contact info to discuss things further.  No wonder they have a poor rating.  I FOR ONE WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING FURTHER FROM LULU LEMON!!!! THERE ARE PLENTY OF OTHER COMPANIES WITH SIMILAR PRODUCTS AND FAR BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!  It's just unacceptable to string a person alon for no good reason!

Customer satisfaction is definitely not a priority. Bought yoga pant for my granddaughter which she wore once and washed and decided she didn’t like the fit . Company would not exchange the product even with a receipt. Just sad that such a reputable company doesn’t guarantee customer satisfaction.
Very good quality, tempted to buy them in other colours!
Rubbish returns. Insanely complicated. In-store not better. Staff too busy chatting and guarding doors to be bothered helping.

Comfortable clothes and fast shipping. I accidentally forgot to put my house number on the order so it was returned to sender. The customer care team were very helpful and didn't charge me extra to reship the parcel. I returned one item in store and it was very quick and easy.

Don't ever return an item through online.  Go to the store instead.  I learned this the hard way as the day after Christmas the lines at the store was crazy so I decided to just ship the item back to them.  The beginning of the process is easy enough.  They send you a return label and you just drop it off.  That's when the nightmare begins.  I tracked my return and it showed that they received it a few days from when I sent it.  I was supposed to get an email saying that they have received it so I would know how my credit would be given ie gift card etc.  After a week of waiting nothing.  I tried to chat with them online.  After 25 minutes I finally hung up and gave them a call.  The service rep obviously was reading from a script.  All they could say is that it takes up to 2 weeks to get a refund.  How does their return procedure take this long?  I can return something from other companies and as soon as my package is scanned they know the return is on its way and my refund shows up 2 days later. All I wanted to do was get a bigger size of the same item.  By the time this is resolved that item will be out of stock.

I absolutely love my lululemon wear I’m obsessed. They are my favorite pairs of leggings . The only downfall is the pricing. I have to admit I’ve only self purchased one of my four pairs . My boyfriend has gotten the rest for me as Christmas or birthday gifts. The price point is a bit high to be a regular customer but the quality is great.

Never a negative experience!My son and daughter both went into the kamloops lululemon and only had to mention pilling on their pants and immediately were given a replacement pair, no cost, no receipt. I am quite surprised at the negative reviews on here! So far I am under the impression that they really stand behind their product!

I had to return some Christmas gifts at Lululemon and I had all the tags and the original receipt as well. Mind you, these items were a gift and I decided that I didn't want/need them. The person who gifted them to me, cut the tags off and did not get gift receipts thinking I would keep them. Well, I explained this to the sales associate, and she told me that it has to go back onto the original credit card since I didn't have a gift receipt. I told her again, that it isn't my fault the person didn't request a gift receipt and I requested to have the credit be put on my debit card since it was my gift. She could only give me instore credit! It is very wrong on so many levels! So pretty much the gifter just re-gifted himself!I went to return an item at the Apple Store and I didn't have the receipt. It was a gift. They happily scanned the item, found the purchase info and explained to me that since it was a gift, I could receive the credit on my debit card! WOW!!! What a concept! Get it together Lululemon and don't give such "sour" customer service!! You have definitely left a "sour" taste in my mouth!!

I've been a Lululemon fan for about 3 years until last december when one of my running jackets started to fall apart as my zipper would come undone while I was running. I immediately took it back and their tailor in the Flatiron location told me that it was suppose to do just that to keep me cool while running, makes no sense. Then the zipper started to get stuck and I took it back again and their manager looked at it and said nothing to assure me the zipper would get better then about week later the entire zipper broke and I couldn't take it off - I brought it over my head. Once again, I went back and this time i asked for an exchange. The sales guy told me they were out of my size and the only place that would have it was their 5th avenue location which I agree to take the subway to that location. To my surprise and shock, the sales woman did not want to exchange it as apparently their was a note in my file saying, 'dont let him exchange anything'.  I was offended and insulted as I've spent so much money on their clothes and to be treated like a con artist was beyond disrespectful for a client like myself. After an unpleasant exchange of words with the manager, she agreed to exchange it for me. I couldn't believe the sales guy at the Flatiron location would write something as awful like that as I consider myself a loyal fan, up until last month. I've NEVER returned anything as I'm always pleased with their athletic apparel and I have spent a good amount of money in the last 3 years as I'm muscular and this brand was a perfect fit for my body type.I was so angry I went immediately back to the Flatiron location and asked to speak to the manager and her excuse was that the note was gone and her sales team has no access of entering notes in their clients files, I didn't buy this at all!! I'm already looking for other similar brands to Lululemon where I'm not treated like a thief!The coat I'm referring to is the Down For It All Jacket and retails at 200 bucks. Play with the zipper several times before purchasing it.

I used the live chat function. Not only did I wait over 30 minutes to get through to anyone, that was all for the rep to tell me “so sorry but we can’t do anything.” I needed to add an apartment number to my order because the rep in store missed it. They said they’ll “pass the message on to FedEx” and MAYBE if I’m lucky it will get added on but they can’t guarantee anything. And after that they had the nerve to ask me if they can give me product recommendations. Seriously? I’ll be lucky if I even get my current order at this point. This was my first and last experience with Lululemon. I am not going to buy anything from them after dealing with this.

I contacted someone in the live chat almost a month ago and still have not received an email back on my returns report. I contacted another two people asking when they will view my report and they kept promising me “by the end of the week” “by the end of today”. I have heard absolutely nothing. It’s a shame to see a brand that you thought was high quality fail you not only with their clothing items but also their customer service.

Lululemon customer service is getting worse, while the products are becoming more expensive and of less quality. I spend a lot of money at Lulu, and was disappointed when some of my clothing started to come apart. While I obviously understand that natural wear and tear on the clothing would not be fair for me to complain about, I also don't think clothing that you're spending hundreds of dollars on should come apart 6 months-1 year after purchase. Their customer service rep "Sarah" whom I spoke to online on January 1st, 2020 is terrible. She responded with cookie cutter responses to my concerns, and then disconnected with me before asking if I had any other questions/issues. Seriously Lulu, I would expect better from you?

just this week when attempting to place an order online I received error code at checkout. I tried with 2 different credit cards then called customer service and was told someone would get back with me.  several days later I received an email requesting that I provide them proof of who I am with a credit card statement which is not even possible since I receive my statements electronically!!!!! I have had orders shipped here to my home for years - same address as always and have never had anything fraudulent happen. and they are insisting that I must provide this in order to place future online orders - completely bogus. I have contacted an attorney to see if what they are doing is even legal as I suspect it is NOT!

The worst customer service ever! Customer service reps lack knowledge and they are not fully equipped/trained to respond to customer inquiries. I was on the phone for an hour 20 minutes trying to get an issue resolved only to have the rep hang up on me. She kept on placing me on hold while she emailed someone to try and get answers on a very simple issue. Ridiculous- wasted an hour of my time and I still didn’t have my issue resolved.

I was in a physical Lululemon location on 12/19, and wanted to get a vest for my dad for Christmas. They didn’t have the right size in stock, but an employee assured me that it was available in the warehouse and if I ordered before 12/22, delivery by Christmas Eve was guaranteed - so I went ahead and ordered. For several days, the status of the package was “processing” - but the estimated delivery continued to say “guaranteed by 12/24”. On the 23rd when I checked and the order was STILL processing, I contacted customer support and they assured me my order would arrive on time. 4pm on Christmas Eve rolls around, still processing. I contacted customer support again, and they confirmed the order was delayed, apologized for the inconvenience and offered a $45 (to be sent via email). Two days later, the gift card still hasn’t arrived. On the line with customer service for the third time, and they tell me that it takes up to 48 hours for the gift card to arrive via email. It is now 4 days after it was supposed to be sent, and still nothing. Absolutely ridiculous customer service. Don’t make offers and guarantees if you cannot follow up! I will be exclusively shopping at Athleta after this experience.

Terrible customer service. I purchased a $50 gift card. They issued me a card with $0 balance. I spent and hour on the phone with a guest educator. He was unable to help me but promised me a $30 gift card as an apology. Lululemon then reneged on their promise. For lack af a better word, they stole $50 from me. For overpriced unattractive athletic apparel, I would expect better customer service. Like many of you, I have spent thousands of dollars in with them on my beers. Never again.

My Christmas items were guaranteed by the 24th. I did not receive the gifts until December 26th. I called Lululemon customer service on Christmas Eve to check and was assured that the package would arrive as it was guaranteed. When the packages did not arrive on Christmas Eve, as promised, I called customer service again. They offered a $20 gift card for my inconvenience. My order almost was nearly $300 and they offered next to nothing. I understand packages being late but around Christmas time guaranteed delivery should be honored. Alo Yoga was late on a package earlier in the month. I didn’t even have to contact them. They emailed me an apology email with a $50 gift store credit. Amazing customer service from Alo Yoga. So very disappointed in Lululemon.

Currently feeling pretty let down by lululemon and their customer service. My boyfriend purchased an item for me with the guarantee that the item would arrive by 12/24 or the item would be free. We still have not received the purchased item and instead of receiving our item for free, we are being offered a gift card, for a lesser value. After speaking to customer service regarding the advertisement for a refund on the item, they let us know that while they value our thoughts they don't offer compensation upon request. The only request we have made is to receive the refund for the item that THEY guaranteed. This was very obviously false advertisement, and it's really disappointing that they are now making us feel as if we are asking for more than what was initially guaranteed. Please make this right!

Made an online purchase of Warm Down Joggers.  The inseam on one side was faulty, it twisted round the leg and was about 3 cms out on one side.After several emails to the pretentious 'customer education centre' to 'share' my experience I was told the only resolution was to take them to the nearest shop.  When I pointed out this was over 120 miles away from me I was told it was tough as they couldn't care if I was a customer or not!Really have never quite come across such appalling customer service as this.
They advertised large sizes but when I got to the store they didn't carry any large sizes.  Salesgirl was snotty and unhelpful.

Placed order on 12/13,  FedEx scheduled delivery on 12/17, and proceeded to reschedule four times.  I contact Lulu after the third time FedEx verbally promised me that delivery would be made the next day.  Lulu’s response was to provide tracking number and tell me it is scheduled for delivery on 12/20.  It did not show on 12/20 and I contacted FedEx again and escalated the issue at which point they supposedly contact the local manager and he assured the delivery would be made 12/21.  I also notified Lulu of the pathetic performance of their vendor and how FedEx  is treating Lulu’s customers.TheIr response below,  with no regard to FedEx’s failures on behalf of Lulu.  I am so sorry to hear about your experience. I understand the frustration your are experiencing. I did want to let you know you placed your order on the 13th of December and out processing timeline is 1-2 business days and 2-7 business days for shipping. We still promise that your package will arrive by the 24th of December. Please allow Fedex to deliver the package as your package is still within timelines. Lulu.....never again,,,

Horrible customer service after confirmed delivery was not made. They hold merch hostage for days to "confirm with fedex" then confirm they lost package and refund me an amount short of what is owed. Had to chase them down constantly to do the right thing and they left me without products just before Christmas. Never order online. Super sweet customer service lacks usefulness. They just don't care.

I returned an item to Lululemon in October.  I was told that since I used a gift card they would refund the portion I paid by credit card to it and the remaining would be put on a gift card.  They failed to tell me that they refunded the gift card portion to the original gift card which I had discarded after I used it.  Four calls later and three different responses I am now going to wait for a second promise of an egift card.  I was told earlier this week I would receive one within 24-48 hours and as it didn't appear in my inbox I called again this morning to discover that Lululemon cancelled that egift card.  No explanation. I am waiting for over $90. I have been on hold with Lululemon for week over an hour over the course of four calls to sort this out and am terribly frustrated.  I will not be ordering lululemon via online again - ever.

I too am not a fan of Lululemon. I made 3 trips back to the store after being promised that boxes would be in soon. I am now told they are out of boxes completely. I spent over 500.00 for work apparel which is all very overpriced with no boxes. I will never purchase anything from this company. I just purchased from a competitor, spent much less for more products.. had awesome customer service and they had boxes with tissue paper. Never again Lululemon.
I’ve always been happy with my lululemon experiences - my clothes are fantastic and if there is anything wrong, they are fantastic with repair/exchanges!!

If I could give negative I would this is the "chat" I had with customer  service, because heck no to an actual live person to talk to:This is on  12/13/2019 after a 10+ hour day with work, trying to order my daughters completely overpriced stretch pants. Tristan: Hi there, how’s your day going?  Cherie Brown: OK, i just got disconnected from my chat a s I was looking to see the response.. this is ridiculous. It tells me to take a breathe? really, There is plenty of funds in the account, the address both on the card and shipping are the same, everything is correct. why will it not process?  Tristan: Oh no! Sorry to hear that! Would you like help walking you through some troubleshooting techniques or would you like help placing the order?  Cherie Brown: Oh boy. Sure,. I am tired and just want this to go through, If you can give me info other than I have provided the correct address both shipping and card, the card number is correct along with the exp and code?  Tristan: In order for me to place this order, can you please confirm your full name, phone number, email and shipping address?  Cherie Brown: Cherie L Brown XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX  Cherie Brown: same as i gave time and time again  Tristan: Will our complimentary 2-7 business day Standard shipping option work for you? Your order will ship 1-2 business days after it has been placed.  Cherie Brown: Yes, I just need it to process? it keeps telling me to take a breathe?" very very annoying  Tristan: What are you looking to place an order for?  Cherie Brown: Align Pant II 25" size 2 in moss rose  Tristan: Thanks! I'll need the full name on the card, the card number, the expiration date and the security code please. Don't worry—our chats are encrypted so your payment details will be blocked out after!  Tristan: It looks like that item is currently out of stock! That may be the reason you're unable to place an order for it.  Cherie Brown: Cherie Brown XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX  Tristan: Is it only that colour you're looking for?  Cherie Brown: yes...  Tristan: Hmm.  Tristan: Would you like me to check the store inventory for you?  Tristan: It's only out of stock in the size you selected.  Tristan: Other sizes are available.  Cherie Brown: yes, as I was led to believe this was in stock. Can't make my daughter grow or decrease? hello  Tristan: Okay. I'll look into the inventory for you.  Cherie Brown: If it is out of stock, then it should state so... do they think i would buy a size too big or too small just because.?  Tristan: I was able to find a few locations with the item available in the size you requested, would you like the names and phone numbers of those locations?  Tristan: I totally understand the frustration as well!  Cherie Brown: ?? so I will have to travel to a far away location because the "wharehouse" doesn't have the item in stock? this is such bad customer service...  Tristan: Not necessarily. Such a sad society we live in  where labels mean  more than price and quality.Response By Email (Tristan) (12/12/2019 09:35 PM)Hey Cherie,Thanks for reaching out to us here at lululemon's Guest Education Centre (GEC).Here's a list of locations along with their numbers you can contact for the Align Pant II 25" in Moss Rose, size 2:Santa Rosa Local - (707) 541-0168Tallahassee Local - (850) 915-0485Secor Village Local - (419) 536-7605Portland Local - (207) 482-6140Downtown Detroit Local - (313) 965-0806Oakbrook Center - (630) 368-1610If you have any further concerns or questions or need any help placing an order, feel free to reach out to us via live chat or phones at 1.877.263.9300.Kind regards,TristanChat By Chat (Tristan) (12/12/2019 09:35 PM)

I have waited in the "queue" for over an hour - 2x. I have been on a text "help line," and I have been on live chat more than I like to mention.  Their service is awful. I have worked for 4 days trying to get an  answer on a shipment I received that is incorrect. I still do not have answer or a solution.  Ridiculous. Lululemon just revoked my membership to their Sweat Collective membership because I am a fitness trainer currently on maternity leave from the industry. I have never experienced such first hand sexist discrimination in my life.

I went into lululemon in Newmarket Ontario upper Canada mall first time so excited I was looking for leggings. Bought a metal tech t-shirt 5 years ago and still wear it. It was expensive ($50) but the quality is there and it held up over time. They also make great mens shorts.

You are overpaying. BUT.Customer service is like no other. Logo worn down? No problem, send it in to get it hemmed back on. Sweat shorts coming undone? Complain about it and they’ll replace it. Amazing.
Happy with their shorts but not the tops which seem to fit small
appalling customer service  - blamed me for them not putting the correct address on an order and then didn't care at all about trying to resolve it!

Literally the worst customer service. Avoid!

The Lululemon staff have got some very healthy egos, just like the company that is employing them. I remember the time when this brand was known for its loyalty and quality products. Well, well, times have changed! I am ashamed to say that I have spent thousands and thousands of dollars on Lululemon over the years.Here is my story. I have never had issues with any of the stuff that I bought at Lululemon except their yoga mats(yuck). And then a couple years ago, I bought a 68 dollar tank top. Within a year, it started developing a hole right close to the seam. I wash all my garments in cold water and hang to dry. Sooo clearly, the issue isn't with how well or how poorly I care for the product. There was a fault in the stitching. Meanwhile- they are down right refusing to take the responsibility for this item! And the staff addressing the situation are simply arrogant and flaky know-it- alls.

I recently bought a pair of the Wunder Under leggings from lululemon for the hefty price of $98 dollars thinking i was investing in a product that would last me a long time. I live in a cold place and just last week I slipped on ice and ripped a hole in my tights. I brought the pair back to the store hoping they would help me due to the fact i already paid them $98 . They said all they could do for me was repair the tights which I was fine with at first. When I received the tights back the "patchwork" was awful, all they did was poorly sew a piece of material underneath the hole. It is completely noticeable and yes, i know it was technically my fault but i expected them to at least try and make it better. I am disappointed in the service and disappointed i wasted my money.
I love my new align joggers I just bought!!Wish I would have bought all my pants in the align material.. its amazing and fits so nice!Expensive but worth the money!

9 weeks in I am still waiting on a credit for a faulty pair of leggings. It's unfortunate for lulu that I am so stubborn. Seriously, my patience has well and truly been tested. As for being 'educated' by the various departments within the rabbit Warren that is lululemon it's patronising at best and plain bonkers on the other end of the spectrum.From being told my leggings were for yoga and pilates only, seriously do I hover from the changing rooms to class? Ridiculous. Despite the stitching coming loose (which is what I complained about) I was told that bobbling of garments could occur when washed with different colours. A. It wasn't the bobbling and B. How can this be caused by washing with garments of other colours?I've had obstruction on how to return as I don't live near a store and now I've been told I'll have to wait as I shouldn't have returned via royal mail when lululemon themselves gave me the info to do so!!Safe to say I'll be sticking to sweaty betty and will warn my clients to steer well clear.

Horrible customer service at the store on Big Beaver in Troy, MI Somerset Mall.  Will never visit a Lululemon store ever again.  Also contacted customer service to only get the “I understand how you feel” canned response with no resolution.  In this day and age, brick and mortar stores should be bending over backwards to keep you coming in.

Shockingly bad, rude, lazy and very poor customer service.  Also in addition Lululemon are thieves.  I returned a pair of yoga pants that were too tight. I retuned by Royal Mail to their Netherlands address as I could not use the UPs label but I used the address on their label. They have kept the pants and kept my money.  They are a fraudulent dishonest company.   This is in contrast to many many U.K. companies who have easy returns and are extremely honest.Stay away from Canadian companies in the future as they may all have the same grubby returns policy of theft when they can get away with it.

Extremely rude sales assistants at London store in Covent Garden. I could not return the jacket that was unraveling after 1 wear! The girl was just laughing in my face! Ridiculous attitude and completely unprofessional. Being a fitness instructor and having spent a lot of money in this shop I will no longer buy anything there. Poor garment quality and the rudest staff ever!

Lululemon originally from Canada should learn that in USA customers expect an excellent customer service. Lululemon staffs are young , rude and simply careless. They have absolutely no clue as to what customer service is. I am tired of being badly treated by unprofessional teenagers as sales people and managers. Lululemon must learn to catch up with times and understand that if a customer buys a merchandise for 180 dollars then they should be able to return it within a time frame. This company is simply ridiculous with their Canadian outdated rules. I will no longer purchase this brand. I am done.

Lululemon is my absolute top website and store to shop for athletic wear. The quality of their products is unmatched by any other brand! The vast majority of the items are well worth the investment and can last for many years. They have superior customer service and if you have any issues it is very easy to get in touch with an agent and they will go above and beyond to rectify the situation. Everything arrives on time and in perfect condition. Totally trust this company!

I returned items and have not been refunded despite contacting them lots of times and them telling me to wait 10 days for it to show. It’s not the first time I’ve had to remind them to refund and I fear I’ve missed refunds in the past! Align pants great but pulling is an issue, overall quality is poor in comparison to the lululemon I loved 10+ years ago.

Go into a store and don’t use them for online purchases. I have ordered a few things online from Lulu and 2 of the 4 orders I have made have come ripped or damaged. First time, they suggested I go to a Taylor on a sweatshirt that was ripped where the tag was. I figured ok, I’m not sending this back and spent 10 dollars on that.The second time, I got a pair of pants that were ripped at the pocket. I wasn’t taking that to a Taylor and requested a new pair to be sent. They told me to go to a store and I didn’t want to do that. They then said ok wait 24 hrs for a response to send clear pictures. I did that and was told that they wanted the pants back. I said I don’t have a box, they were clearly damaged so finally after 10 min of back and forth I was told to donate the pants and they ordered me replacements.1 hr later, I get an email saying we don’t have the pants and we need the ones you were told to donate back to get a refund. I already donated them. I order a different pair of pants.Pants #2 arrive, wrong size. Go into a store and get the right pair of pants. My time is worth more than this and this company doesn’t care to fix problems.If the ABC pants weren’t so comfortable, I’d prob stop shopping here all together. But go into a store, they don’t care about CS at this company.

Will make your life worse.I liked the pants but had to return two other pairs.  Despite the "free returns" I had to pay for postage, which I was told would be refunded.  Nearly a month later and I haven't received a refund for either the pants or the postage.  Every time I email them, I'm told to go to their "live chat", which is always full, or call a number that no one answers.  It's the worst customer service I've ever experienced.  It's not worth buying the pants to experience this hell.

I have been a customer of Lululemon for over a decade now. I’ve spent thousands of dollars and have always loved the clothes until recently. The quality has gone waaay down and the prices have gone way up. I have had to return or exchange 4 items of clothing now in the past month and a half because the seams are coming apart on the pants and the shirts have material that has pulled after one wear! The pants were $150 dollars and the t-shirt was $70.... that should NOT happen. I have clothes from Lululemon from 8 years ago that still are in great shape. Please change whatever you are doing and go back to making quality items or people will not shop there anymore. I know they have definitely lost me as a customer now.
What customer service. Purchased pants and washed less than a handful of times and they tell me that I ruined the article when it’s clearly material issues.

The product was good but don't pay for express shipping. I purchased it on a Wednesday and needed it by Saturday so I paid for Express shipping- an extra $20--> not cheap. The clothes arrived the next Monday. I complained and they said that it was 2-3 business days and that even though Friday was within 2 business days, Saturday was not a business day, so a Monday delivery still counted as in-between the 2-3 business day timeframe. I mean seriously, who pays an extra $20 for it to be delivered in 6 days? Also, for retail, business days typically include weekends- their retail stores are open on weekends. Not a high-end experience from a company who claims to be high-end. Paid an extra $20 for 0 added value.

Fitting was fine.   But, these commuter pants that I purchased do 'NOT BREATHE'..... I cant wear them while Im traveling as they do not let heat escape and I find myself sweating like a horse.Have to wait until winter to wear these pants.   Very unhappy.

They made a mistake. Sent me someone else’s order. I had all of this persons personal information. They didn’t even apologize. Didn’t offer anything for my troubles of returning the other item. Person on the phone made it seem like this is a common mistake.

Honestly, I use to love this brand. For years been buying gym wear from there. Even once I’ve contacted the customer service which was so helpful. Now it’s gone opposite direction. I’ve ordered few items, and the energy bra looks awful straps has changed, it looks like it’s going to fall apart after few washes. Leggings doesn’t have string to prevent from falling down, no pockets and fabric isn’t stretchy and elastic like it use to be. So I’ve used the UPS label and dropped of at the shop and it has gone missing. I can’t track it, they can’t track it. Instead of offering resolve the issue they said I have to wait 2-3 weeks it might be found and than up to 10 days till refund is processed.Come on guys! Sort yourselves out. You’ve lost one more costumer.

Lulu Lemon has the absolute worst customer support and they provide no solutions when there are errors or issues on their end of things. My order never arrived and there were no updates on shipping. They first said it would take two days to find out what happened and then would get back to me. Four days later I called and they said it would be another four days to find out what happened. They offered to refund me but I want the leggings I ordered. They said they had a limited number in stock so they could not guarantee a replacement order would be filled. Am I wrong or isn’t having a system that shows stock there to tell you exactly if they have the product available. It’s ridiculous that they can just say that I will maybe get my order unless they can’t fill the order with the stock they show having on hand. I have a gift card so I need to shop with them but they really have the worst support for being such a popular company.
Returned items 3 weeks ago and still waiting for refund !

I have been a customer of lululemon for over 10 years.  I purchase at least 4 pairs of pants every year, plus other clothing.  I recently contacted their customer service over three pairs of pants that I had purchased, that all came apart at the seams.  Like completely apart!  I spent well over an hour, two different chats, gave them all the info three times, emails, photos, all well they are telling me they will solve the issue.  I get a reply that it is normal wear & tear, or external force and they won't honour their quality guarantee?  Really?? I have never had this happen with any other pants in my lifetime.  I do not have the perfect body, my thighs do touch but to spend over $100 on each pair and they don't last 3 months?  I have been a huge supporter of this brand, have dozen's of other pants that have not come apart at the seams but apparently this is normal wear & tear.  Get your act together lululemon.  You lost a customer and will continue to lose more if you don't get your quality control together.  I would not recommend purchasing the luxtreme fabric, as these were the ones I had issues with.  Spend your well earned $$ elsewhere, as if you have an issue with their product, they won't stand behind it.  Sidenote:  I tried leaving reviews on their website, on different browsers, devices, accounts etc, and it is not possible.  They block you from leaving any sort of feedback.
Clothes might be okay, but don't expect any response from their helpline or online chat.
My favourite tights brand but getting too expensive!
Quality of the product is great. I had an awesome experience ordering from this company. Placed my order and then picked up at the store the same day. Will definitely be purchasing from them again.

Absolutely amazing clothes, if they rip you can take them back and they will fix it up, the actual fabric is really strong i have had clothes from lulu for over 3 years and they are in perfect shape, even final sale items are returnable and they usually have GREAT customer service
I love my aligns, super comfy and look great! they are super expensive though.

I WAS a loyal Lululemon customer...... until.... I had a top that I had worn maybe 4-5 times and it began to show a lot of piling in very little wear time. So I chatted with their customer support team and they setup a return. The item was denied a return and I was told it was “well loved”, um NOPE 4-5 wears is certainly NOT well loved. They shipped it back to me and the worst part, which I couldn’t even believe... it was returned to me with a HOLE in the side that was not there when I sent it to them. I was told if I sent it back in they would consider it trash and dispose of it. I’ve never been treated that way by Lululemon and it certainly didn’t upload their guarantee. The damage of the item was outrageous and I think someone that works there should be fired. I’ll never shop there again. Over priced and under quality.

My daughter ordered a pair of shorts 3 weeks ago and has still have not arrived ! When I called them the lady was very rude And told me that they were delivered and it would take another 5 days to track package! I asked her to send a replacement pair and she hung up on me ! Order c12296102140

Lululemon has the worst customer service ever. I ordered two items from there they charged my card for the full amount. The next day they separately charged my card for each item. I will never order anything from this horrible company ever again.

When I was younger I always bought Victoria’s Secret pink leggings,  until one Christmas my husband got me my first pair of Lulus and I fell in love.... I love the Align pants, but boy oh boy the quality in the pants are honestly so terrible! I’ve had to return and  exchange my pants probably about 10 times now.... The lady at the desk had mentioned that it was only for yoga and that I shouldn’t wear them to work (I work with kids not at a factory)  but she literally told me not to wear them to work ..  i’m sorry, but when it comes to leggings you shouldn’t have to only wear them for certain activities.  My boss gave me $150 to go shopping at Lululemon, and I even tried to sell my gift card because it’s just a terrible place to shop at, because you always have to go back to exchange something. Quality is horrible, loving Forever 21 products way better!  I never like to complain, but being comfortable at my job, and during a workout is everything, but knowing I constantly have to go back is just a hassle. The leggings are also soo expensive. It seems FedEx delievered my.package to the wrong address i am being told i have to wait 5 days till the company contracts me.
