Just got my ‘Simple there triangle brallete’. Very comfy! But after reading the reviews will update whether the item is long lasting and of good quality.Two stars only because there’s wayyyyyyy too much plastic packaging involved. Why bother  with plastic wrapping when so many companies these days just chuck in your lightweight items into a paper envelope? Won’t buy again, unless there’s a change in packaging.
Very good service, selection and experience. I have brought merchandise back to them if I have had any issues and they have always been willing to accommodate free of cost!
Great experience & awesome fit.
so expensive, just buy gymshark instead

Shocking customer service.Be aware if you're thinking of returning something then they will try and hold onto your money for as long as they possibly can! Their customer service is appalling - when you try and find out where your refund is after the tracking number says they received the item over three weeks ago, they essentially ignore you and use patronising and cutesy language to dismiss your concerns. They owe me over £150 for goods i have returned (brand new, unworn, with tags on) and are refusing to acknowledge that there is an issue in the fact they haven't processed the refund or confirmed it... Terrible!
The lady working at the customer service helped us, however our quality issue was not. Lululemon doesn’t honor their quality policy! They lost 3 customers in our household.
LuLuLemon....appalling delivery service Ordered item on 20/6....still waiting. Tracking service useless. Do not use

Terrible customer service.  Worst ever.  Spent $30 for expedited shipping that was not at all expedited.  Item came with the sensor tag still attached.  Options were to send the item back to the warehouse which "will take a few weeks", or spend $30 on UBER to go to a store to have the sensor tag removed which is not something I have time to do.  So between $30 on expedited shipping and $30 on UBER, spent $60 for an item that came late, and still not ready to wear. Spoke to Brenda and she is awful.  Refused to let me talk to a manager . . . or more likely it appears managers just don't talk to customers!  Would be ashamed to be associated with LuLuLemon.

Worst customer service ever!  Do not order online!  Guaranteed delivery by Father's  Day. Charged my card, sent me a shipping confirmation with delivery date and tracking number.  Did not arrive and mysteriously changed to label created 4 days ago  PENDING.  When I called they said it shipped but had no information could not even confirm if it had left the facility blamed FedEx.  When I called FedEx said was not shipped.  Unorganized, mess do not order online!

I ordered a pair of shorts over a week and a half ago, and the tracking did not work until today, and now it's saying my order will not arrive for ANOTHER WEEK. Every rep I've talked to has told me a different date of when I should receive my order, and the kicker is, I can't even get a refund until I receive my order. God only knows when that will be. They're incompetent, unorganized, and I would not recommend them to anyone. SAVE YOUR MONEY. Buy from Gymshark. They're all the way across the ocean and I still received my order faster than Lululemon. NOT worth the pricetag for the lousy service.

The only thing I hate is sale item you ordered online is final sale, no return no exhange. Seriously?? I order sth online never touch or try on until I receive them. unlike in store I get to touch, feel the material and try on then I know if fit or not. This is not right and fair, lululemon!  Please change the policy for sale item online at least have the shoppers can bring back exhange and get a store credit or sth!!
I bought the mens casual jean style pants and love them! Best pants I own.

Lululemon does not live up to their "quality promise".  I wanted to return a pair of pants and they will not take them back, citing they do not qualify which does not make sense. The quality promise says: "Product quality is the foundation we stand on and this foundation is comprised of three key areas: fabric, performance and craftsmanship.If our product doesn't perform for you, we'll take it back."The Luxtreme fabric stretched out after one wear, and the material felt cheap and thin. It was hardly the "hugged sensation" as mentioned in the description. Also, the waistband was very uncomfortable--too narrow and does not live up to the description of "no dig waistband that is soft and lies flat against your skin." There is no reason the return was denied.  I wasn't even asking for my money back--a gift card would suffice.  Will not be buying Lulu anymore.  Too bad they lost a loyal customer.
I love my lululemon align pants. After getting these leggings I haven’t been wearing anything else than my Lulu’s, and would definitely recommend! And don’t forget to wash them inside out. :-)
What a surprise - the 'take you order and money' part of the website works but the 'free return' because it doesn't fit part doesn't. Won't buy again....

Lululemon has on their website a "quality promise" where "if a product does not preform for you, we'll take it back".   I had 2 pairs of yoga pants, wore them once, and one pair would slide down so much, I had to keep pulling them up.  Another pair kept rolling at the waist, making it very uncomfortable.  I called customer service and they they said no, they will not accept a return.  I tried taking it to the next level, and again, they again said no.  They will not honour their promise or what is written on their web site. With the terrible customer service, I have decided to unsubscribe from everything Lululemon and buy from other Canadian Companies from now on.

Seriously worst experience ever. Bought my first pair of Lululemon leggings for about $100 back in fall of 2017. After two wears, the inseam frayed and was hanging down at my barre class. Took them to the local Lululemon store and the cashier stated that the only option was to send them back to the company to repair them. That was 10/17/17 according to the ticket. I just got them back last month, that's 1 1/2 years later. No note or anything. Seriously??!?? Don't buy lululemon!!!!

So i finally decided to buy my first ever pair of lulu lemon leggings. Paid $120.00 for them.  I got them home wash them on cold and hang dried, wore them ONCE. I washed them again (same way they told me to when i bought them).... Well a bunch of the stitching in the knees came loose and frayed. They are already falling apart after only wearing them one time! I did not pay $120 to wear a pair of pants once. I contacted lulu and without a reciept "there is nothing they can do" so i contacted them again and was told "you can ship them to us in the mail and we can asses them and decide if we send a new pair" If i spend $120 on a pair of pants, i should be able to take them into a store and extange them for a product thats not falling apart. But now i question if the next pair wont fall apart. I love how lulu lemon promise quality assurance and say any products not good will be taken back but apperently not without a reciept. So $120 just went in the garbage and i will continue to NEVER shop at lulu lemon again. Absolute scam of a clothing line. Thanks again lulu. Ill go back to my $6 leggings from forever 21 that last me forever and never fall apart like your $120 product does! Ill go back to paying $120 for 17 pairs of "cheep made" leggings that last!

Absolute favourite athletic clothing store! Align leggings are revolutionary, truly, you’ll never regret purchasing a pair. Lululemon gear is trendy, comfy, and of great quality all around.
Fav brand, excellent service - would always highly recommend lululemon for the highest quality clothes for the gym.

Place an online order.  Receive a shipping notification with a tracking number for an item that never ships. Incur a credit card charge. Deal with a snarky condescending “ambassador”, reading from a script, offering assurances your item shipped, contrary to FedEx’s tracking system. Beg for a refund for an item the merchant never shipped charged you for. The above you can experience all for placing an order with Lululemon. I’m 50 years old and in 30+ years have never had a poorer experience with a merchant.

I bought 2 pairs of 28" wunder unders in New Zealand last year. I had issues with them falling down (correct size), so returned both pairs to the Manchester GB store. I felt that the customer service was excellent as I was immediately offered the option to choose 2 new pairs. No quibble, no haggling. Thank you Manchester! I love the wunder unders, and have 4 pairs now. They wash really well, and perform as a pair of leggings at that price should. My experience of lulu (NZ and GB) has been a positive one.

Failed to refund me for my returned order. Thankfully i paid PayPal, and they said that lululemon had refunded me but then cancelled that. But lululemon we’re completely unhelpful, and totally adamant they had refunded me even with PayPal records clearly indicating other. PayPal will hopefully sort it out, as i can’t make these people see sense, their even trying to say refunds from other orders are for that transaction... they don’t have a clue!!!

They are NOT HELPFUL at all. When I was placing my order I selected priority shipping method, and it was supposed to arrive today but I have not got it yet. I live-chatted with them and they said there was nothing they could do and did not even apologize.

I love Lulu !!! My legging fabric on two of my tights were having these weird fuzzy balls all over . The manger in Charleston , South Carolina exchanged them in 1 min . So happy , 6 months after me having them ! Really amazing costumer service & happy yogi girl with my tights :)

The entire experience is awful. This company is so overrated from service to product itself. I purchased online, but the package never arrive and despite that I tried to write or call them sooooooo many times all they tell me is that there’s nothing they can do, and suggest that I should go to Guest Education Center.Yes Guest Education Center. How rude. Seriously don’t buy at this company!

I seriously cannot believe what’s happening.  I ended up purchasing clothing for my employers girlfriend online with my Personal ATM card because they cancelled my previous order when I used my corporate card and claimed that order might be fraudulent.  The only way I can use my corporate card in the future is to send them my credit card statement!!  I called the bank that issued my corporate card and they have no records of fraud reported.  Today I look at my personal bank statement online and Lululemon charged me multiple times for the same order.  When I called to tell them, they said this is common practice? They said when items leave the warehouse I am changed again and they will refund the second charge in about 10 days.  What the heck is going on??  That order was almost $900.00. I can’t afford to have $1800 taken out of my bank account for no reason.  I agreed to pay the total of the purchased clothing only once!!   I’ve never encountered such horrible practices and customer service in all my life.   I called my bank and reported the charges but I still have to wait to have the money returned to my bank account.  This cannot be legal!  How is Lululemon getting away with this?

The "service specialists" that email you back regarding and incident of your product is terrible. They clearly state on their website that if the product is not performing due to quality then they will take it back. I have a scuba hoodie that zipper broke and they refused to take it back. As a long time customer I spend a lot of money at Lululemon and Iam very disappointed in the service I received. I hear Fabletics is good, I will probably change and buy their products after this.

If I could put no stars I would unfortunately that is not an option.I recently had a horrible experience where my lululemon gift cards got frauded. lululemon has done nothing to help me or return my funds to me.Someone random person called and gave my Gift card number without the security pin number  and lululemon customer service asked no security questions (name,email,home address)to verify the card belonged to me. Lululemon drained my cards and reinstated my 358 dollar funds to someone that they have no record of. Not to mention their tights are so poor quality that I've had to return many tights for the poor and defected quality of the clothes. I've had this horrible experience of fraud so I've learnt that lululemon does not secure the protection of their customers and do not care.protect your card number even without your pin people can scam your money.

Fast shipping, great free return.I've had very good experience with them whether to return via mail or online order. It took five business day to receive a refund and took only three days shipping my new order. Customer service via chat box is great. I suggest doing online for everything.
Good product looks nice and arrived on time
The store manager at the outlet is so disrespectful and awful I shop there all the time ! I Never go back !!!

Customer service is awful they are now plain ignoring my emails. they have lost my package TWICE - never notify me I always have to email to ask what’s going on with my order eventually they just put the money back into my paypal (without telling me) and offered a free item which they then told me was out of stock (after I asked 1 week later where it was) they keep saying they will call me but haven’t. I would not recommend buying online at all .. this has been going on for 6 weeks and now they just are ignoring me

Extremely disappointed! I spend SO much money here! I’ve only 1 time in my life have ever exchanged anything, not returned... exchanged. And today, I tried to exchange, not return, a pair align capris because they were in the wrong sized shelf when I bought them, and they said they couldn’t. Couple things, yes my fault for not double checking, and my fault for instinctively removing that back annoying tag that they allow to rip off but still. They can send them back to corp or the manufacturer to sew the tag back on instead of “throwing them away” they said, because that tag was missing. They should take a lesson from Nordstrom! I’m not a 1 time shopper either. Again, I buy everything there, have never returned and have only exchanged one time in my life. Time to find a new brand. Athleta I hear is good as well as P’tula.

Terrible customer service. Imagine paying £100 for shorts wanting to return completely unworn and untouched but missing the return date by 1 day due to work. Shocking. Will definitely never use again. Plenty of other BETTER shops.

Great clothes.But their online ordering is a joke, has taken over a month to receive an order, with the package being shipped backwards and forwards between their Melbourne warehouse and NZ.And their call service workers "educators" are hopeless, they say things like they will email you tracking information but never do.

Great customer service.I had an issue with one of my orders and I contacted customer services via the Live Chat option - they were polite, extremely helpful and resolved my problem immediately.The clothing I received is fantastic - it all fits great and is of a high quality, very happy and will definitely order more

I bought my gf two $50 gift cards for Christmas,  A day after she used them she received an email saying that her order was cancelled with no explanation.  After two phone calls to Lululemon, they told her that the gift cards had been used 3 years ago.  I just bought them on Dec 23, 2018 at Shoppers Drug Mart and 5 days ago I sent Lululemon the receipts and the activation receipts with the card numbers on them. I have still not heard anything back from them, and this is very disappointing.

I was excited to try Lululemon after my friend was raving about her leggings. I was intrigued and placed my order and after a few days I received an email that my order was cancelled. There was no explanation as to why in the email such as the item being out of stock. I didn’t bother to follow up but what a horrible first impression. I would rather shop elsewhere than give them money.

Having being a customer of Lululemon for years and once in the past returning items with no problem I really rated them and the quality and longevity of their beautiful clothing. Recently I have been let down by my normal size no longer fitting and being too big. So I returned items bought from a birthday voucher. This was beginning of December. I have given them the tracking number etc and chased and spoken to several staff. Still no refund or update. A week ago I was given a £25 gift voucher for my bad experience but no refund yet of my £96. I thought great I’ll get a tank top with that £25 voucher on the sale. Size 10 which I have ordered before in tops arrives and looks more like a size 16. It’s the UK website so I am ordering my U.K. size. Or should I be using the U.S sizing? Who knows. Very frustrated another return to be sent and who knows if that gesture of goodwill will ever be reimbursed along with my gift card and cash. Come on Lululemon I expect more from your brand.

I had heard lots of good things about Lululemon clothing so I was really excited to try out the clothing.  I placed an order with them and quickly received an email from UPS giving me a delivery date.  The parcel did not arrive on that date, or the two subsequent working days.  The tracking information also stopped being updated.  I called UPS to see what was happening.  UPS were very helpful and told me that there was clearly some kind of problem with the package but that I couldn't ask them to do anything about it and I'd have to call Lululemon to get them to raise a claim on the package through their account.  Nice and efficient...I called Lululemon and, after waiting for a patronisingly titled 'Educator' to pick up the phone, the 'Educator' informed me that I would have to wait in AGAIN, wasting more of my time, to see if the package arrived that day. If the package did not arrive, only then would they raise a claim.  The woman I spoke to was really patronising and appeared to not believe me when I told her that UPS had told me that a claim should be raised now because there was clearly a problem with the package.  It was incredibly rude of this 'Educator' to ask that I waste more of my time waiting in for a package that I had been told would not arrive BY THE PARCEL CARRIER THEMSELVES!!!  Unsurprisingly, the package did not arrive that day.  At this point, I just wanted my order cancelled, my money back and to not have to deal with Lululemon's patronising customer service ever again.  So, the next day, I called Lululemon to tell them that the package had not arrived but that I just wanted it recalled and a refund processed.  They told me that I would now have to wait another 4 working days so that UPS could find the package.  Only then could a refund be processed.  I am so, so unhappy with Lululemon's customer service.  As far as I am concerned, the missing package is now an issue between Lululemon and UPS - after all, only Lululemon could raise the claim via their account.  Despite this, Lululemon is now asking me to spend more of my time and effort resolving this issue with UPS by waiting an additional 4 working days. So far, I have wasted 2 days waiting for packages that didn't arrive (1  day of which was completely unnecessary, as I was told by the carrier that the parcel was lost!) and 1 hour of phone calls to UPS and Lululemon discussing the missing package (30 minutes of which was also unnecessary because I had to call Lululemon again to ask them raise a claim AGAIN, in accordance with their request the first time I called them).  Now, I have the joy of looking forward to 4 more working days of waiting for the issue with UPS to be resolved. Lululemon clearly do not value their customers' time or respect them.  The clothing may or may not be great - I'll never get the chance to try it.  I won't be ordering again.Update:  In classic incompetent Lululemon style, I received an email from Lululemon several days later asking me if I had received the parcel (I hadn't). I am not sure why Lululemon did not contact UPS to assess the situation, and instead decided to ask me to do their job for them!  In their email, Lululemon also advised me to call a Canadian number if I hadn't received the parcel.  If they had been competent enough to look at the UK based delivery and billing address, it might have occurred to them to send me a UK number...Anyway, I checked the UPS tracking information (because I had not received any calls, emails or missed delivery notes from UPS) and saw that UPS said the parcel had been delivered to a UPS access point and that I needed to collect it.  This was despite me telling Lululemon several times to return the parcel back to them as soon as it was found by Lululemon.I contacted Live Chat immediately and explained that the parcel should have been returned to Lululemon. The agent was very helpful and quick to respond (hence why I have increased my review from 1 to 2 stars) and issued my refund immediately.

I placed my first order IN STORE Madison, WI. The order came promptly but reeks of perfume/fabric softener and has pilling around the sleeves. It had pulled seems and a stain. We are talking the kind of perfume that makes your ENTIRE bedroom smell of another human. I just wanted them to expedite a new item without charging me for a second because this was NOT my error. They wouldn't. This item had been worn. There was NO WAY ANYONE COULD HAVE MISSED THE SMELL of Fabric Softener/Perfume on this. Disappointed. If anyone else begins making shirts with thumb holes I'd switch in a red hot second.

So let me start this off by giving you a little background into my body shape. I'm a 5'2 Latina that has 34G cup size and is a size 8/10, I run and practice yoga and every now and then a spin class. So I'm not exactly a blob but I certainly have plenty of curves. My sweet boyfriend got me a $300.00 gift card to Lulu for Christmas, not knowing that I don't wear their clothing bc well they simply don't cater to my body shape or to my style of clothing; I'm definetly not vanilla,and love an array of colors and bold prints , which this company typically does not offer. So I contacted a few of their stores to speak to an actual person and at all location received an answering machine, who even uses these anymore?? Finally, called the 1-800 # and spoke to a very kind and soft spoken lady who after 20min of conversation told me I was pretty much SOL for $300.00 even if we had a receipt for the purchase. I even explained how I don't use their products because they don't make my size in tops and for bottoms I don't like their fit. They were pretty rude about it and told me we were simply out that money or to trade it with someone else or to buy an accessory. I just think there needs to be something in place for people who receive a gift card to a store they don't shop at nor believe in what they stand for.

I bought an item through the UK website for my wife this Christmas. Unfortunately, due to a glitch with the fulfilment process it became apparent that it would not be delivered by Christmas Eve as promised. However, when I contacted Lululemon by phone, their representative in Canada was an absolute pleasure to deal with and the way she found a resolution demonstrated some of the best customer service I have ever experienced from a company. The outcome was that despite being let down initially, I came away with a very positive opinion of the brand to the extent I felt compelled to write a review.
Nice collections, price is a little on the higher end but you get what you pay for :)

Non-existant customer service!  Would never shop here again. I live in England and while visiting Canada I Christmas shopped for my two daughter`s and daughters-in-law back in England.  I purchased over $900.00 worth of clothing. I needed a refund on one item that was duplicated.  Unfortunately, I have mislaid my receipt.  The item is in its original bag with tags still on.  They absolutely will not refund without a receipt despite the fact that they only retail in their own stores and I could not possibly have bought it anywhere else!  Shame on you. I wanted to give no stars but this app does not allow that.  Will never shop here again and will spread the word wherever I can on this awful company!  Bah humbug lululemon.

Terrible customer service and terrible company to deal with!  Placed order and your computer system failed to process it but took my money out of the account and now I have to wait 3 to 10 business days to get my money released back to me!  Never offered anything for my trouble and inconvenience of being without my money.  Now I won’t hsve my money until the week before Christmas and will be too late to order without NOW paying for shipping.  Don’t even know if the jacket will be in stock by that time!  If it wasn’t on my daughters list I would never buy from this company again!  Terrible, terrible customer service and I will Be glad to tell everyone I know and on social media how terrible this company is!

Before I found Lululemon, I thought that finding aesthetically pleasing yet also durable workout attire was impossible. I’ve been a sweaty generalist for about three years now, and have struggled tremendously when it comes to finding clothes that don’t make me feel sloppy while I work out. I’ve bought all sorts of different brands, expensive and cheap, and could never find a perfect pair of leggings. When the European brand Gymshark first became popular, I was super into their leggings. As a girl with hips, it can be ridiculously hard to find leggings that are squat-proof but don’t slip off my waist. A couple of years ago, Gymshark released a line of “Flex” leggings that contour your butt and have a thick waistband on top to prevent any slippage. As the leggings were a bit out of my high-school-junior budget, I drooled over them online until I could finally afford to splurge. I bought a pair of gray Flex leggings with a pink waistband and wore those bad boys until they were too worn out to wear. I actually just recently dropped them at my local thrift, and a couple tears might’ve been shed. Those leggings saw me through every new workout max; I squatted 185 lbs in them - a goal that took me a whole year to reach. I’ve had a couple of other pairs of Flex leggings since that first beloved pair, and they’re still my designated leg-day leggings. They’re squat proof and comfy, and I guess I have a bit of bias since they were my first pair of “cool gym girl” leggings.When I graduated high school I decided I wanted some high quality leggings that weren’t only for working out. I’ve known about Lululemon leggings for quite a while but since they’re super expensive I never really considered buying them until then. I stalked a whole bunch of fitness models’ Instagram accounts to see if the hype was worth it, and I decided it was. I bought the 25” Align Pant 2’s in black and almost died at how perfect they were, so I took every precaution I could to prevent hurting them. I never wore them to the gym because I was so afraid they’d get ruined, and washed them alone and air-dried them like the tag said to do. But after only a few weeks they started to pill. I did read all the reviews thoroughly before I dropped that hundred bucks, and did see that other people had complained about the pills but I still went for it. Since I do have thicker thighs I expected it might happen at some point. At first the pills weren’t too bad and didn’t seem to be getting worse. But one day I wore them on a hike and when I got home the inner thighs were almost completely covered in pills; I was so disappointed because they were the softest, most flattering leggings I’d ever worn. I kept wearing them since I wasn't about to just throw away a pair of such beautiful leggings, but they never really felt the same. Eventually they were so pilled I could barely wear them, so I emailed the Lulu staff to see if I had any options. I was so shocked to find that I could get a brand new pair if I mailed them back. I hadn’t known prior, but Lululemon stands behind all of their gear so if something isn’t holding up well they’ll replace it for you. Within two weeks I had a brand new pair of beautiful Aligns that I vow to never wear hiking again. As I’ve said before, these leggings are so soft and flattering, but if you’re looking for a more durable pair I’d definitely go for a different style like the In Movement leggings (which are also super soft but more durable.) Lululemon uses different materials for different leggings- the Aligns are made of Nulu fabric that is buttery soft and feels so light it’s like they’re barely there. Since this material is more delicate, it’s not the best for high-friction workouts such as running or hiking. Stating the obvious here- a hundred dollars for a pair of pants you have to be so careful with is kind of a lot of money. However, if you’re willing to pay the price these leggings are flattering and beautiful and really can’t be beat. Once I started wearing Lululemons I could never wear any other brands (besides Gymshark). Although the price is high, Lululemon leggings are the best workout pants you will ever have, and the customer service is unmatched. If your Lulus don’t hold up, take them to a local store or simply email customer service and they’ll make it right. Yes, they’re pricey, but the quality and customer service Lululemon offers makes the whole experience so worth it.
Great customer service, my order never arrived and they resent the package free of charge with a $100 gift card. This is better than any customer service I have spoken to.

I have shopped at Lulu for years for both my daughter and myself and have been happy with the products in terms of quality and durability.  My most recent experience however has been so unacceptable that I can’t even begin to express how disappointed I am. The customer service personal for the company are a complete joke.  I have now called 4 times about a lost package that was never delivered to my home.   The information received from each representative has been different, each one giving me a different timeline for when I would have information back on the status of the package and each one describing a different process for addressing the issue.  During the last call I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told that there are no supervisors.  One reapesentarve told me that they had 4 different dates in the computer for when the package was delivered.  The package has been missing for over two weeks now and I am out 400.00 and have nothing but frustration to show for it.  I have spent literally thousands of dollars with this company over the years.  But this level of customer disservice will have me thinking twice about ever returning as a customer.

I placed an order for 2 pairs of the In Movement 7/8 leggings size 2 which were both WMTM sales. My order was accepted, confirmed and a confirmation email was sent to me. I was charged for both on my credit card and 2 days later my order was cancelled without reason.I was told it was because they were sold out and there was nothing they could do. The lady I spoke with refused to transfer me to someone higher up and would not give me her name.Minutes later the lady told me she could give me free shipping if I purchased leggings at full price. The shipping is already free. She offered me size 16 in the ones I ordered...I am a size 2.The customer service for lululemon is horrible and the fact that they are selling items they dont have in stock is simply ridiculous. I will never order or shop at lululemon after this experience. The company is a joke. Dont waste your time ordering. I'm still waiting to be reimbursed for my order they cancelled. They take advantage of their customers and refuse to do anything about it. Hands down the worst experience I've ever had. If they keep it up they will not have any customers.

I love the lululemon products but I hate their customer service.  They are obviously given a speech to recite and are very unhelpful.  They are often unwilling to do anything unless you spend time contacting various sectors and they don't share that information willingly claiming "they are the best person to assist you" which is not true because they have no power to help you with the situation.  My experience is that I have often had to call back on multiple occasions because things have not been completed correctly.
I love all of my Lululemon products but really wish they had better customer service. Never a great experience when I have to deal with them..

I LOVE lululemon! I have shopped in 3 of the physical stores in the UK and I can't fault them - their staff, their products, everything is great.  They even offered me a discount because I'd been waiting for a particular item for so long and there was a trouble with the delivery of it.The online store is also great but I do have a small issue about not being able to buy from the USA site :-/ I would love to be able to benefit from those products when buying from Europe.....Thank you!
Great company, the online staff are very helpful!

To be honest, I am SO shocked at these negative reviews!! I just started shopping at lululemon, but the customer service is the reason I will continue to do so. They returned a pair of Wunder-unders that I was unhappy with (with free return shipping) and most recently, my Fedex package disappeared - super frustrating, as I have no idea who stole it. Lululemon quickly refunded me back to my card! I do think they need to ask for a signature though... skimming through the reviews, I see that a lot of people have had the same missing package issue... but customer service is a 5/5! the GEC is amazing!

I’ve spent over 10,000 but notice there are never any blacks working in any of the stores, which is odd considering that the area has plenty of black and Hispanic works. I’ve stopped using their clothing period and will make sure we (me and my blog team) expose the made in China brand!!!

checked online what is available in the store then went tot the store to try it on...service clerk told me its not available in storeeven though I was one of two customers in the store and there where three assisting customers the one that assisted me was talking on the phone and left me standing there... did not even attempt to look for item...totally rude...will not go backEdmonton south side late summer

I reported a credit card fraud right after the transaction was made online. And I requested lululemon to cancel the order by giving all the information they needed.  However, the customer service was beyond poor. I emailed twice at first, the response I got was just deferring my request, saying sales team would follow up and someone else would touch me in 48 hours. I was naive and patiently wait for the follow ups. Unfortunately I was deceived. No response, no one follow up. I talked to the live chat and emailed the cs again. The transaction was made on 18 September, and today is 26 Sept, the cs finally got back to me after 8 days and said the order can’t be cancelled because it will be delivered today!  Lululemon is still charging me for this order which is delivering to someone who stole my credit card  How ridiculous of Lululemon handling customers’ request. I strongly believe they were just stalling me until the order was sent. I am truly disappointed how Lululemon values customers’ requests and fails our trust. They don’t treat credit card fraud as a serious business so they probably don’t see how important customers’ credential is either. I will never make purchase at Lululemon online and in-store again.

I have so great experiences with Lululemon: they have fixed my gym bag strap that was coming lose, the replaced a pair of workout pants that had a hole in them and gave me like for like. I can’t fault these experiences so why 3 stars...their ridiculous policy ‘no refund/no ex-changes on final sale items.I don’t have an issue with this policy of buying in store as you have the opportunity to use the fitting rooms and check the product for any defects.I do have a big issue with this policy for online orders. When I asked a store assistant, their excuse was ‘it’s always been this way’ (from an insider ex-Lululemon employee friend, I know they are brainwashed to worship Chip Wilson and it’s yoga cult where they are drinking the look-aid) The fact that they won’t even exchange a final sale item if you have ordered the wrong size or if there are defects.This is Canada so I don’t know about consumer laws here very well but I know in the UK under trading standards, retailers have to offer at least an exchange.Needless to say I’m not prepared to buy final sale items online and as much as I like their products, I will have to continue to shop in store or at the outlet stores in Washington.Lululemon - you need to change this policy

I’ve been a loyal customer to lululemon for quite some time now, I have spent a great amount of money shopping at lululemon. the quality of some clothing hasn’t been the best, I must admit, some of my pants and tops have the seam coming off, however, I continued shopping there. On my last purchase, fedex lost my package. I contacted lululemon 2 weeks later and they told me they would contact fedex and to wait a few days and reach back to them. A few days later, I reach back and I get told that they need to contact fedex again, so to wait another week and reach back. I knew the iteam wasn’t going to be in stock by them so I told them my concern about the iteam being out of stock by then and all they said was I understand your concern. So a week later I contacted them back, and surely enough, the iteam was out of stock, I got my refund back, but the whole situation was super frustrating, I don’t know if I will continue my services here again.
Sizes are weird.

Package left outside door bc signature wasn’t required,  someone took the package,  Waiting to hear back ...no call.  I finally contacted FEDEX myself.  Made 3 phone calls and was on hold for over 20 minutes.  If you enjoy wasting your time and getting the run a round...keep shopping here!

I love lululemon! They have great customer service. I had a three year old pair of leggings which they no longer sell and I could remember the type or size. They lasted a long time but the seam came apart. I emailed and got a response within a few days and a full refund although I was required to send back the pants but the shipping was paid for by them. As well I love that they are branching out more into lifestyle clothing as opposed to the traditional yoga/workout wear. A big plus for me as well is free shipping (at least in Canada) as often I'll abandon my order why I find out how much shipping costs. This helps make up for the expense of the clothes. Tried and true fan! 100% would reccommend and I personally love the On The Fly Pant as they are one of the most versatile items in my closet.

Lululemon has the best customer service I have ever had the pleasure of speaking with. If my pants start pilling too early, or if I don't like the fit of something I purchased awhile ago, they are always willing to give me store credit so that I can purchase something new. Everyone I speak to is so kind and helpful. Really awesome and nothing beats their align leggings!!!

I had a pair of the trow back pants in my shopping cart, and was checking out and the page refreshed and the pants were no longer available. I then called customer service to see if the pants had sold out.. which they had, but the employee gave me 3 store numbers to call that had the pants. I was able to buy them from a store in California, and I had them at my house within two days. Excellent customer service.

I have never left a review before, but I felt inclined to leave one today because I was so impressed with LuluLemon. I’ve always loved the company for their products and brand image. However, today I had a call with customer service. The most pleasant customer service call ever. So kind and willing to help. I am just so impressed and amazed that they genuinely cared about my needs!

Terrible company to deal with.  Purchased a pair of running shorts in January. By May the lining seam had separated.  Contacted lululemon who:i) At first didn't respondii) Asked for photos and lots of detailsiii) Then asked for shorts to be returned (at shared shipping cost)iv) Sent a gift voucher for £14 less than the value of the shortsNow July and still not got this sorted despite numerous emails, calls etc.Throughout the process lululemon were unresponsive and difficult to get hold off.  Took ages to agree that the shorts were faulty and lululemon made me feel like they thought I was trying to swindle them.  Wouldn't use this company again EVER.
Their clothes are made to last a lifetime and if they don't, they will give you money towards a new purchase. LOVE their clothing, it fits so well and doesn't shift while you're moving.

Putting aside the cost of Lululemon apparel, it is beautifully made and fantastically comfortable to wear. I have their basic long sleeve tee and its my absolute favourite. So why 2 stars? Ordering from their website is like stepping back 10 years, ordering an item that shows as in stock, waiting (im)patiently for the new item to be delivered .. only to receive an email cancelling the order (quite unapologetically) as actually they made a mistake and the item isn't really in stock ... chat to their customer service team and get a virtual shrug of the shoulders. So the moral of this story/review is go into one of their stores, if you know someone who can get you a discount great, and avoid their website until they get their act together where stock management is concerned.

@lululemonlive #lululemon Don't ever buy gift cards from LULULEMON there is no security..don't find out the hard way. I'm out $400 because one of their employees decided to let someone use my giftcard without the actual card...just a screenshot of the card..and they brush me off
Biggest fan. Supported them since the beginning. Some sizing issues but always help.

Ordered a gift card for my nephews birthday on 4/12. Delivery date on website stated delivery in  2-7 business days. Should have been delivered today. Called customer service and was told they add an additional 2 days for processing. In addition. On the tracking site it shows my package sat in Ohio for 8 days. When I stated this customer service told me that I need to call the USPS. Ridiculous. I entrusted Lululemon with my order. They are responsible for my order. I will never do business with them again.

I like lululemon and everything. But I do have some issues with their staff. The black knob thing that they have on their clothing items that will beep when you walk out their doors and is impossible to take off your self is my first complaint. I just bought a pair of align pants and when I looked at them when I got home, it turns out they still have that black thing on them. And this isn’t the first time this has happened to me either. It’s a real pain for me because I don’t live very close to the store and I do have other things I need to do. It’s very annoying because of the staff could just pay a bit more attention to their costumers then it would save everyone a lot of trouble.

I would have preferred 21/2 stars, but I went up to three.  This is as the sales lady honored  her word to return a sale item, sale items are final.  But she had told me to try on the Fleece Hoodie at home and if it still felt tight I could bring it back for a full money refund.  I wore it at home and it felt snug thus I returned it, she provided a full money back refund.   I liked her too she was genuine and sincerely concerned that the Hoodie should be comfortable.  I am a size five, but Lulu. does not carry in between sizes, which they might consider doing.  As well a key concern is  the fabrics are a poly/cotton mix, I only wear 100% cotton and most items at Lululemon are a synthetic/cotton mix.   As well as people are increasingly concerned re: their health and the environment they like fabrics made from organic cotton, organic hemp and bamboo for example. I wear organic bamboo socks/and bamboo yoga pants.   Thus I find the Lululemon brand is focused on health and wellbeing but their products which contain large amounts of synthetic fabrics is opposite to their brand.    I actually get a rash from wearing synthetic fibers, poly is made from oil.  I am not anti oil, albeit we are transitioning to renewables globally but I do not like to wear oil based products for obvious reasons.

I have now twice in quick succession had an order cancelled after recieving an order confirmation (the irony of the header: 'we've got your goods'). The excuse is that, as their system isn't 'live', they can happily keep on selling - and confirming orders for - items they do not, in face, have. Indeed, items out of stock are still on the website several days after they have ceased to exist anywhere but in Lululemon's imagination.Don't be fooled by order confirmations.
$98 pants have a rip in them when I received them out of the package, but because I didn't notice this until I took off the hang tag, they will not refund me. Ridiculous

I usually shop at Sweaty Betty but gave Lululemon a try as their online range is more varied. I ordered a swiftly long sleeve top which arrived a few days later. No email communications to say my order had been received or dispatched. I was really disappointed with the quality of the top. The colour (white) was a greyed white and the fabric felt cheap, like it would stretch out of shape. I returned it but had to chase up a refund which after 10 days still hadn’t been issued. Again, no email communications to say the returned item had been received. All in all a poor experience and will stick with Sweaty Betty in future.

Have had a number of dealings with Doncaster lululemon and I would not recommend them in the slightest. Faulty items not repaired or exchanged, ongoing ACCC complaint to get this rectified. Old sale stock at other stores sold at full price.  Also we had a gift that was from a friend mere days after the returns policy date not allowed to be exchanged. They really are dodgy and I would stay clear and keep your money safe.

I don't understand all the negative reviews! Only discovered Lululemon recently and placed 8 orders total over £500 spent since December and all gone smoothly. Their stores are too far from where I live and all my purchases were online. Everything fits and performs perfectly, I only had to return one item. One thing to note is they refund the items on sale despite the t&c saying they are final sale - that does not apply to the UK. Refunds take around 2-3 weeks given their warehouse locations & 2nd class post but you will get your money back. Their product choices and quality are far superior to Sweaty Betty (their competitor) where I used to shop!

I enjoy hot yoga and was tired of the wet sliding warriors and furling towel issues, so my yogi let me try her black rubber mat from lulu - loved it - so went to Bellevue Square store in Washington to buy one. They don't make the sticky rubber mat anymore, so I spent time talking with a sales woman about my needs for a super-sticky no-slip hot yoga mat - they did not have any unrolled to try out - the sales woman she steered me to the 3mm mat - and also advised, "try it out, if it doesn't work then bring it back". So I did try it out and it was just as slippery as my old mat. I cleaned it after one class, and took it back to the store with my receipt, and was told that it could not be returned unless I had the original packaging - which amounted to a piece of saran wrap plastic that went around the center of the roll. I told the clerk I wanted my money back - gave her receipt and clean mat - and she steered me to contact the online customer service - I told her I did not want to do that since I still have a mat I don't want - I want my money back. She wouldn't do it - would only give me store credit. I am so frustrated by this store not standing behind their products, giving out bad advice, and not giving a lick about a good customer experience. I took the store credit and will give it away to a yogi in need. I am never shopping at lulu again. You'll find me at title9 or athleta for my gym gear from now on.

I recently went to a location in downtown Toronto (yorkville location) & had an amazing experience with knowledgable, friendly, polite & helpful staff. When I went to the cash, I told the cashier the name of the sales associates if she needs them (I assumed they were working on commission because of how helpful they were) and I was told they she doesn't because they do not work on commission. No oohing or ahhing by the sales people at every legging I tried on, instead I got respectful suggestions for items I may prefer instead. They also gave us two lululemon bags for free instead of the one because I had mentioned I liked both designs. Amazing!

I ordered a jacket online and it didn't fit, so I returned it exactly as instructed. It has taken 3 weeks, several emails, and 5 phone calls to get my refund, and I was told it will be another week before I see my refund on my credit card. Though I like their clothes, I will never buy from Lululemon again. Too much aggravation, and other companies are much easier to do business with.
Over priced & inadequate, smug service. Failed to resolve problem caused by assistant not responding for 10 days to request for them to rectify problem. Will never use again.

Hi I bought the latest black innovation Bra from Westfield  within  one month of wearing  the  £82 Bra it snapped  to my surprise the bra hook got broken Went to  the nearest  lululemon in Regent street  asked for it to be taken back they said can't,  asked for an exchange said they do not have it in black  asked for a different colour  said do not have my  sizeThen I  said I will pay extra money  $ exchanges the damaged Bra for a jacket they happily did thatI feel I have been robbed of money Not to mention the two cropped tights  I bought with my damaged Bra  are  also  damaged  now with the strings coming out

They screwed up my order for Christmas and when I live chatted with them it took me about a hour to fix THEIR SCREWUP!  I asked for the possibility of a gift card for my inconvenience, and was refused.  Just lost a customer Lululemon!

I tried to buy a scuba hoodie for my wife for christmas. However, the company sent me the wrong item. The company robbed me the joy to see my wife's reaction on a gift that i picked out. The company did not want to compensate me anything. They only going to offer me free return (which they already do) and expedited shipping on the replacement. Lululemon charged a lot for their products. You would think they have better customer service than this. This is my first time buying from this company to test out their quality. Never again.

Ordered a xmas gift allowing plenty of time - 3 weeks before xmas.  Item never arrived via FedEx.  I reordered the same item a second time 7 days before xmas, as stock was running low.  The website promised delivery within a couple of days. After a weeks wait, the FedEx tracking showed it stuck at some location for 5 days with no movement. This was my first experience with this website. 2 out of 2 orders went awol with FedEx and never arrived.  Refunds were processed - I got my money back but definitely not worth the angst.

Worst Customer Service I have ever experienced.   I ordered 1 item and it never arrived.  I have contacted lululemon multiple times via the Live Chat option.  They refused to do anything until after the 7th shipping day even though FedEx notified me on the 5th shipping day the package was lost and they had issued a trace.  Finally after the 7th shipping day lululemon said they were putting in a trace request with Fedex (This was already done on the 5th shipping day) and I would have to wait another 4 days for a resolution.  I was also told by lululemon I would receive an email with the trace information immediately, which I still don't have.  I ordered the item as a Christmas gift which I'm obviously not receiving and have to figure something else out.  Customer Service should have offered to re-ship the item or a refund and dealt with the missing package on their own.  Either have it sent back to them if found or deal with the insurance claim if not found.  Instead they make the customer deal with the problem.  As of now I have no gift and no refund and am still waiting to hear something about the trace.  I will NEVER give a dime to this company again!

All my orders with Lululemon have been a headache but this last one was the worst. I made one order, they split it into two packages. Meaning double the delivery hassle with Fedex. In the end, more than 3 weeks passed and I still didn't have my package as it was delivered to a stranger that signed for it. The items are now out of stock. Lululemon representative did not even apologize on behalf of Lululemon (basic common courtesy), nor did they offer a discount code or something of that kind which seems to be pretty common for many quality brands/businesses. Disappointed
Never had a problem with Lululemon when ordering online.

I love the pair of blue yoga leggings I have from Lululemon! It has held it's shape through several washes already, and I wear it almost every day. It keeps me warm while being breathable, and I'm so excited to get another pair!
Excellent mat

I bought a LULULEMON Yoga Mat and I had an asthma attack! The first night, I kept the yoga mat in my bedroom by thinking that I will have a nice stretch in the morning. I woke up with the difficulty to breath and I was coughing a lot. I was not sure if it was really the strong smell of the chemicals from the LULULEMON Yoga Mat but every time that I was getting closer to it, I was heavily reacting to it. When I read about the chemicals used for this yoga mat, I figured out that their chemicals used are toxic and can dangerous for your health.I went immediately to the store to share my experience and I had a hard time to get my refund! I still cannot believe that the lady told me that with the time, the strong smell of rubber will get away! She did not understand that it is not about just a smell but a product that can be dangerous for your health!Tonight, I have pain in the lungs and strong headaches, the smell is still a bit in my bedroom and I have to wash the towel that I put on the mat. The towel smells like the disgusting tire of a car!I was never born asthmatic, there are a new study that say: asthma and allergies have increased in the developed world during the last 30 years. The companies want to promote nice new products by using strong chemicals to make the product to look good but bad for our health and it just makes us sicker!Please look for a hypo-allergenic Yoga Mat instead and please do not encourage the products using dangerous chemicals!

I received Lululemon gift vouchers from my friends as b'day gifts. So I used one of them to buy a scuba hoodie online at Lululemon website. I also paid extra for fast shipment. The package arrived on time  but the content was a bathrobe from other company that is not even related to Lululemon. I reported it and they said they will handle it and will let me know. On the second day after my complaint I asked for the follow up update, and they told me they had to track the missing item first and it will take 4 days then they will send the item to me, and if they can not find it, they will reimburse my money. Their solution is not a customer friendly and it annoys me. If they do care about their customer, they should send a new package of the item that I ordered and deal with the missing item themselves. You can not make it as the customer's problem. It's not the customer's fault that the item package got mix up. I refused to wait that long and asked for the refund. I am not even sure if I want to buy items from Lululemon anymore but I have to do something with the rest of the gift vouchers :(

Awful service. I bought a pants here but it got pills right after one time washing. Then the store blamed for the material that have to be pilling. After all they denied to exchange although they said in their commercial “our quality promise if our product doesn’t perform for you we will take it back”

I was waiting for processing of my return during 2.5 months! One months after sending the item back to Lululemon, I've realised that I didn't receive my money back. I've checked my Lululemon account where I find out that the status field of the return is still "in progress". So I've contacted customer service, where they told me that they received my parcel and the refund should be issued in a couple of days. One more month passed and I still didn't get my money, as well as the status was still "in progress"! Contacted the customer service again, I was told that they "experienced a small hiccup". What?!.. May be they think that as this is an expensive brand, their customers don't care about money and can forget about 68 GBP missing in their wallet?! Never in my life the return process took so long! In the end, I was told that my parcel never reached their warehouse but “in order to make things right” they will still be refunding me for the item.Disclaimer: that was my first online order from Lululemon, so I don’t have any other (positive) experiences.

I have never experienced better customer service. I was given a present of some items and none suited. I brought them into the store in dublin and they woman that helped me went above and beyond to find what fitted me and what I was comfortable in. Just exceptional!
I called the number listed and  received good service. I am happy! They told me the exact date of my package arrival.

I am utterly fed up of trying to buy Lululemon stock online - and this review should be another reason for LuluLemon to pull their proverbial finger out and fix their website.I kept trying to buy a pair of shorts and a vent tech but the system kept telling me my card didn't have funds - even though it has 30x the amount needed!Anyway, I chatted online to the customer service rep to find out what was going on... she looked into it and found out that one item - the vent tech - was out of stock. I told her it was unacceptable to display items as 'in stock' and then give wrong error codes to customers when they try to check out.I then selected another vent tech for my yoga practice (I'm a teacher) and I got exactly the same error. I then tried to check out the shorts - and all items are, in fact, out of stock.Ugh.Such a terrible online shopping experience, I wonder how on earth LuluLemon actually serve any of their customers online.

THIS IS NOT A COMPLAINT. My LuLu Lemon leggings starting wearing after 2 months because I was wearing these leggings in high friction, high-intensity workouts when they're made for yoga. I called corporate and they were so sweet and understanding and all I had to do was ship my leggings back and they gave me store credit! So easy, so understanding, very pleased.

Very hard selling - regardless of customer requirements. I was persuaded to buy a running top on the basis that once I was wearing my running bra I would look fab. Got home, tried it and looked RIDICULOUS! No refunds or exchanges on sale items so I'm stuck with it. They may have hit their sales target but they've lost a customer. I'll never go back and never wear the top. Complete waste of my pension.

I'd heard much about the excellent items from lululemon, so I finally made an online purchase from their UK store. I really wanted to try their Wunder Pants and I found a perfect pair in my size. That was enough for me, however I browsed a bit more and, lo' and behold, found a perfect sweater that matched it! Yay! I got super excited, ordered both and received my confirmation email.Two days later, I receive another email saying my order has shipped.Oh, but... One part of my order isn't available anymore. I'm like "what?" Oh, it's the pair of pants that's no longer available and actually now I'm just getting the sweater, which I only got because they matched the pants... Obviously I'm disappointed, because I really don't need a sweater just for kicks.So I contact the help desk, explaining the situation. Turns out their warehouse systems were down and actually those pants were out of stock. Fine, these things happen. But I'd still very much like the pants or, alternatively, cancel my order altogether. Turns out cancelling isn't an option, because the sweater is already in transit. And then... the only thing the poor girl could come up with was to give me individual store phone numbers in the UK, which I could then proceed to call myself to find one that had those pants and have them shipped to me.I mean, are you kidding me right now? Not only did I order something that I am not receiving because YOUR systems failed, now you're asking ME to solve YOUR problem?! Horrible customer service, will be returning the sweater as soon as I receive it and will never order again. Bye lululemon. You have been weighed. You have been measured. And you have been found wanting.

Ordered a present for my husband, after items had not shipped for 5 days I contacted the company myself and they said sorry but they should have told me it was out of stock. Pretty poor considering it was £168 for shorts and a shirt. Nice stuff but don't bother ordering online

I had a very positive experience with this company several years ago. So when I decided to up the quality (& size) of my yoga mat in the summer of 2016, I really didn't hesitate to spend in excess of $100 for the mat & strap. Quality has been subpar. The rubber/PU compound has simply not stood up well at all.  At both ends of the mat, the material has deteriorated / stretched out so that it actually buckles causing my feet to slide, well within 6 months of purchase. I should add that I use it 3-4 X per week, I am a man 6'3", 175 pounds. Never hot yoga or even power yoga for that matter. It is an oversize, reversible mat. Based on the online reviews, it seemed as though it would be a good quality purchase, from a respectable customer focused company. I stopped by the local store where it was purchased, earlier this year to inquire about this issue. At this time I was asked to bring in the mat. 2 weeks ago I did. The staff member was quite friendly and accommodating. She agreed to replace the mat. Then when retrieving one from the shelf, they realized that mine was oversized (big). It was explained to me a the store had no stock of this item and that a replacement would need to be ordered. The ensuing confusion in regards to the process of ordering a replacement was almost comical. I volunteered to pay, in advance, for the replacement mat (even though I had paid for the original as well) in order to keep and use the original until such time as the replacement arrived. So a week later I received an email from Lululemon that my mat had arrived (as well as a pair of shorts I ordered at that time) and that I could pick up the items at any time. So I went to the store an hour or so later. The shorts they found right away. I stood around for about 30 minutes waiting for the mat to be located. Eventually it was determined that the staff were unable to locate the mat BUT it may be in the multiple unpacked boxes received in the back. I was told to expect a phone call before close that day to advise me of the status. Nothing. Frustrated, the following morning I went on the Lululemon 'live chat'. Again I left quickly with zero news. Then again last Friday I went on the 'live chat'. I guess that the company is extraordinarily disorganized. I received the excuse of "FedEx" lost the shipment... We require 4 businesses days to inquire, you will receive an email the following day, Saturday. So I did indeed receive a comical email Saturday, just checking to see if I had yet received my order. You have to be joking, it was being shipped to your store. I was getting (even more) irate at the inept service at this point, and replied to the email expressing my displeasure, reiterating the fact that I had paid for the replacement mat almost 2 weeks prior, and Lululemon didn't appear to be serious about providing me with a resolution to their screw up. Apparently they have issued a credit to my card (why this could possibly take several days to "process" is beyond me, the payment certainly showed up instantly. So I still have a defective mat, no refund as of this morning. Apparently 2 stores about an hour away do have the mat in stock. I quess I will take my chances with a replacement next time it is convenient to get there. VERY DISSATISFIED CUSTOMER. PS. The shorts I ordered are still in the package, so based on the experience I have decided to return them. This morning I go on the Lululemon site and follow through to the return page only to be informed that I have no purchase. Bizarre.Just a quick update. The shorts. I have returned to the company, eventually with the support of an employee I did receive the proper return email. I have kept up with the tracking via FedEx, they received last week and no news yet. The mat. I was downtown a couple of weeks ago and had an extra hour, so I went to the Lululemon store and they exchanged the mat for a new one. I hope it stands up a bit better. The company is incredibly disorganized, I recognize the 'modern' version of customer service removes any personal treatment...it is an issue with most bigger companies. I only wish that after such a colossal screw up by the company, that perhaps 1 person could be assigned to make sure the customer was being looked after, reassuring communication is always a good thing. The cost of my driving around, parking, time... Has never once been acknowledged. A simple 'thanks' frequently goes a long way! Overall I would give this company a 1.5 / 5 for the customer service. Most of the people involved were decent and accommodating. They did accept returns. However the corporate policy is abhorrent with almost all focus on the company and their bottom line. Communication is very poor as I was forced to initiate all correspondence.Quick update.  The replacement yoga mat performed exactly as poorly as the initial one... Less than 6 months of decent use... So rather than attempt to deal with the Lululemon juggernaut of incompetent customer service... I simply ordered a new mat from a competitor... Manduka. Now I have had this mat for app 4 or 5 months now... Hands down a much more pleasant experience. I strongly recommend anyone shopping for a new yoga mat to avoid Lululemon at all cost and explore the alternatives... For me the manduka pro extra long mat is perfect.

I ordered some of their products and I am not happy about it. First of all, they check your credit card paying ability by withdrawing 5 $ from it. I still have not gotten them back although it`s been a month since the purchase. Moreover, the product got to my place with a one-week delay and in bad condition. The colour of the T-shirt I ordered doesn`t match with the one depicted on their web-site. P.S. I am going to order something else that is for sure!

Ordered, money taken from card but receive email saying your order is cancelled.You have to ring them to find your order is out of stock and advised to keep ordering (and presume money being taken) until it is delivered. This is not efficient to order something and then have to spend every day checking your bank account to ensure your money has been reimbursed - which it hasn't yet...

Lululemon marked by mistake 6 items bought instead of 1 causing the customs to go way up. I spent with them a few hours on line. They wouldnt refund me.This is a good lesson for me and I would never order from them online again.  This time I got lucky and lost only 150$It could have easily been more
Absolutely love lululemon! Wish some styles would get repeated, limited quantities get competative!
The product is perfect and I received it in three days without extra costs!! (I live in Italy). I will order again soon!

Overall, Lulu is a great company. The service I have had with them has more often than not been more than pleasurable. Esp. online shopping. Talk about a breeze! Any problems I've encountered have usually been fixed immediately. Also, they really do stand by their product. If it is poorly made they will take the item back. It is true that some of their items are a bit overpriced for the quality that you get but other items are consistently well made, and those are the items I stick too.

lululemon is all about design, and trying to understand what their customer base is looking for. Sometimes they are a little off, but most of the time they are right on target! From perfect fitting yoga clothes to non-chafing running gear, they make a fantastic product that lasts a good 3 years. If you are serious about your practice or sport, lululemon is the product for you. If you're just wearing it to be trendy, it's a little expensive, because, hey! That's not was it was designed for.

Sometimes i wonder how they come up with the prices because they are not worthy at all. The design may be different somehow but you can get much lower prices from other shops. It is really not my cup of tea. Sorry.
In Europe and want Lululemon Sports attire? Check-out Lululemon.com: order it, pay it and receive it in 3-4 days!  Great could not be better! Thx!
Was referred by a yoga friend to this store and absolutely love it. Have really good deals and always had everything I've needed. Would recommend to anyone who is into yoga.

I love Lululemon attire. It's not only beautiful, but it's made with little details in mind that no other fitness designer seems to think of. A little tiny pocket to slip your key in while you run so you can be hands-free and clothing that breathes and moves with you... these are just a few things that this company has managed to work into their designs. My only complaint is that the clothing is a bit overpriced. I do love the designs, but come on... $98 for a pair of yoga pants? Okay, I know they're not just *any* yoga pants, but still. I would recommend investing in one of their jackets. Can't beat the quality or the design.
